loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca, 60, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Rebecca operates a food stall. She sells snacks like banana cue and kamote cue. Banana cue is a popular snack food in the Philippines of deep fried bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar. Banana cue is made from Saba bananas. Kamote cue is made from sweet potato. It is coated with brown sugar and then fried to cook the potatoes and caramelize the sugar. It is usually skewered on a bamboo stick, and is sold on the streets.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar, oil, and gas. 

Rebecca hopes that her business will expand soon and dreams of having a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar, oil and gas needed for her business.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es: El Sr. Wilson tiene 19 años, el se dedica a la confección y arreglo ropa, el se dedica a esta actividad hace dos años, su taller se encuentran ubicado en la zona norte de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Wilson utilizara este préstamo para compra de maquina recta y over para la confección de sus prendas de vestir, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital de trabajo, El Sr. Wilson enfrenta retos en su negocio que son seguir mejorando la calidad de la confección de las prendas de vestir y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir aumentando  su  capital de trabajo su deseo para su negocio es crecer y confeccionar variedad de prendas de vestir El Sr. Wilson se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Wilson is 19 years old. He works in the manufacture and alteration of clothing. He has done this work for 2 years. His shop is located in the north zone of the city of La Paz. This loan is his first cycle within the institution. Wilson will use this loan for the purchase of a sewing machine to make clothing. His reason to request this loan is lack of working capital. Wilson faces challenges in his business that are to further improve the quality of the manufacture of his clothing. He is going to use the profits to continue to increase his working capital. His dream for his business is to grow and to make a variety of garments. Wilson feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support given.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is a 49-year-old married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has five children. The oldest child is 22, while the youngest is 4. She raises pigs. 

Aside from hog raising, Ma. Elena operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells commodities like sugar, condiments, soap, eggs, cooking oil and toiletries. She has been in the sari-sari store business for five years. Her husband is a carpenter.

Ma. Elena requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more items to sell like soft drinks, noodles, seasonings and canned goods. 

In the future, Ma. Elena would like to invest in other ventures to support her family, as well as save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soft drinks, noodles, seasonings and canned goods.

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is 58 years old. She is married and lives in the small village of Mtskheta district with her husband Vakhtang. They are involved in the agricultural business. In particular, they have 2 milk cows and 2 calves. 

Natela produces cheese products and sells milk and cheese locally. Besides the agricultural business, the family has a vineyard and sells wine. 

Natela is known as a hard working woman among her villagers. She requested a loan to build a greenhouse. After building a greenhouse, she plans to purchase seeds for flowers and grow different kinds to sell at a good price. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase items to sell, such as soap, canned goods, eggs, and spices.

Margarita has been in this business for 2 years. She also earns additional income from a restaurant.

Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as soap, canned goods, eggs, and spices

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura is married with 5 children. She is 64 years old and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Maura sells snacks to earn a living, and she has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more raw ingredients for her business.

Maura has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack-vending business

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a business in front of her house by doing motorcycle services.  

Alina is making a good income from the motorcycle services. She wants to buy more stock with the loan and pay for the mechanic who works for her. 

Alina is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to fix their motorcycles. She opened her business in 2010 with her own working capital.

loans.use: to buy tools, oil, and keys.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Marlyn works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Marlyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store, such as spices, canned goods, snack foods, and sugar.

Marlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her previous 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as spices, canned goods, snack foods, and sugar.

loans.name: Sokheng's Group

texts.en:
Sokheng is a breadwinner in her family. She is a rice farmer and a tailor, and her husband is a construction worker. They have two children. Sokheng has been in business for 5 years, and she is able to earn up to 25,800 KHR per day. Two cycles ago, she received her first loan through VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has successfully repaid back her loan and notes its positive impact on helping her to relieve her family’s burden and improve its livelihood. 

For this loan cycle, Sokheng wants to improve her family's hygiene. She is the leader of a two-person borrower group. She will use loan to build a decent latrine for her household. She hopes that this latrine will promote good, healthy practices for her family, especially for her kids.

loans.use: To build a latrine

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married, but separated, with six children. She is 34 years old and lives in Situbo, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Evelyn sells clothes to earn a living. She has had this business for 4 years, and each month she earns 6,000 PHP. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase more clothes to sell. 

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Tahira's Group

texts.en:
Tahira is a 45-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 3 sons and 3 daughters. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. 

Since 2002, Tahira has been running a business selling milk. She has 2 buffaloes. Her husband also helps her in the business. She takes care of the buffaloes and her husband sells the milk in the main market. 

Tahira has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase one more buffalo for her business. This will help her to grow her business and to increase her sales and income. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them. 

She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase one buffalo to sell milk.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 44 years old and married with seven children.

Meriam works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Meriam has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business of buying and selling charcoal for 10 years and also earns an income from a general store.

Meriam aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her chidlren to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Amarsanaa

texts.en:
Amarsanaa is a forty-nine-year-old married man who has two sons and lives with his family in the outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. The area lacks basic infrastructure. His two sons are very independent. The elder one is a student at a local university, and the other one works in Korea with a labor contract.

Amarsanaa has been operating a public transportation service business since 2000, with special help from his spouse, Gantsetseg. When they first began their business, they bought a minivan which was produced in 1995. After nine years, in 2009, he changed the old van for a new one which was produced in 2001. 

The current house in which the family lives became so old, it requires some renovation work. Amarsanaa is requesting a 4,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase necessary construction materials, now that they are very cheap.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials necessary for renovating his house.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice, a salonist, is a 32-year-old hardworking lady. She has been operating the salon for four years and has gained a wide variety of customers. 

Beatrice approached for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to pay for her sister’s school fees. She is grateful for such an opportunity. She has been our member for the last three years.

loans.use: to pay for her sister's school fees.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is married with five children. She is 47 years old and lives in Namnama, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.

Rosalina grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

Rosalina has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her garden to plant other crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines. 

Mila has been in this business for 6 years. She earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables and spices to sell.

Mila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetable and spices to sell

loans.name: Dianne Michelle

texts.en:
This is Dianne Michelle. She previously received a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy supplies for her laundry business. Her earnings were a big help in providing an education for her child and in meeting her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Dianne Michelle is applying for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy an additional washing machine and products like fabric conditioner, fabric soap, fabric spray, hangers, and other supplies. Her profits will help her to meet the family's daily needs and to pay for her child's educational expenses. She looks forward to an anticipated increase in her income with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Dianne Michelle hopes to find a good school for her children. She dreams of opening new branches of her laundry business in other places. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for an additional washing machine and supplies needed for her laundry

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian has been selling used clothing for 2 years. She lets her customers know when she is going to have new merchandise. With help from her husband, she has made sure that her children attend school, which fills her with a lot of joy and pride. With her income, she helps to support her family. Lilian is asking for a loan to buy assorted second-hand clothing like pants, shirts, and men's and women's footwear. With this investment, she hopes to keep growing her business, so that she can set up a larger store in the future.

loans.use: to buy assorted second-hand clothing like pants, shirts, and men's and women's footwear.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 63 years old and lives in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with two children. Erlinda is engaged in the coconut and copra buying business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional coconuts and copra to sell. Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Erlinda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconuts and copra to sell

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Nelly works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice. Nelly is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Nelly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 49 years old and lives in Villalin, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. 

Daisy has a dried fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional dried fish to sell. 

Daisy has been a member of PMPC for 12 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional dried fish

loans.name: Lubna's Group

texts.en:
Lubna is a 22-year-old woman who lives in Pakistan with her husband. She is having one son. Her husband is a taxi driver whose income is too low to cover their household expenses. Since 2011, Lubna has been running a beauty salon. As a member of a five-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase cosmetic products like lipsticks, facial creams, etc. for the salon. With the profits, she wants to renovate her house and repay the loan. She wants to thank all the BRAC staff for being so co-operative. 

Note: In the picture, Lubna holds a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products like lipsticks, facial creams, etc for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 43 years old and married with three children.

Perla works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Perla has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 22 years and earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

Perla aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, etc

loans.name: Celinia

texts.en:
This is Celinia, 46, a resident of Dasma, Philippines. She is married to Feliciano, the owner of their auto repair shop, and is a mother to five children. By the grace of God, Celinia has managed to support all her children’s educational needs. At the present time, she is working hard to be able to maintain her finances for her youngest child’s college education.

Celinia operates an auto repair shop. Her husband is the main mechanic while she handles finances, accounts, inventories, and promotion. They offer repair, check-ups, and beautification of all types of cars, jeepneys and any type of vehicle that is referred to them.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy supplies like wirings, putty paint, etc. It will also be used for the maintenance of their repair machines. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Celinia hopes that their business will continue to grow and expand. She dreams that all her children will be professionals. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for materials needed in her auto repair shop and for the maintenance of the machines.

loans.name: Zamig

texts.en:
Zamig is 32 years old. He is married and the father of two little children. They all live together with his parents and brother. His parents are pensioners. 

The source of income for the family is from a grocery store and agricultural activities. Zamig’s wife and parents are engaged in agriculture. They have milk cows whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell cheese locally in an open market. Zamig and his brother work at a grocery store they have rented. 

Zamig requested a loan from VFAC to purchase basic groceries. This will keep the store developed and increase the income of the family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for the store.

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
This is Leslie, 39, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She has children and she manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. She has been in this business for 23 years now.

Leslie operates the buy and sell business of her family. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell them for a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 17,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items like polo shirts for men and women, socks and shirts to expand her product inventory.

Leslie hopes that her business will get bigger. She dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional merchandise like polo shirts for men and women, socks and shirts needed in her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 52 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living with her poultry business in the Philippines. Susan is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her chickens.

Susan has been in the poultry business for 25 years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her chicken

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a married woman with four children. She sells seasonal fruits and vegetables such as pears, oranges, apples, bananas, onions, potatoes, and cabbages. Khadija has ten years of experience in this field and has gained the necessary skills and knowledge required for her business.

Fruits are very popular among the people of Mombasa and, they are in high demand throughout the year. People like to eat fresh fruit, and it is one of the main desserts given to guests. Her shop is located in a bazaar. People always pass her shop and come to buy some fresh fruit. 

Khadija wants to expand her business. She does not have enough products to cover the high demand. She would like to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase her turnover as well as improve the lives of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Joven

texts.en:
Joven is married with six children. She is 55 years old and lives in Palayan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Joven has a small restaurant to earn a living. She has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 7,750 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her restaurant business.

Joven has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren is a married woman. She is a mother of three children. She makes a living selling seafood.

Today, Caren survives by selling seafood in her humble locale. She opens her business in the very early hours in order to receive customers who are in search of fresh fish, shellfish, and crabs, which are some of the various types of seafood that she sells.

Caren is requesting a loan in order to buy fish, crabs and shellfish. With more and better products, she will be able to receive a greater income.

Caren hopes to grow and improve the infrastructure of her neighborhood and to offer high-quality seafood.

loans.use: to buy fish, crabs and shellfish.

loans.name: Laurito

texts.en:
Laurito is 66 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married with five children. 
Laurito is engaged in hog-fattening and fishing activities. He earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan which will be used to purchase sacks of feed to fatten his hogs. 
Laurito has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Laurito hopes to run other types of businesses.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of feed to fatten his hogs.

loans.name: Edna's Group

texts.en:
Edna is 44 years old and lives in Guintomoyan, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children. 

Edna is engaged in tilapia fish culture and a hog-fattening business and earns approximately PHP1,800 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional sacks of feed for her fish pond and hog-fattening activities. 

Edna has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Edna hopes to expand her business.  Edna is the leader of a 2-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To  purchase additional sacks of feed

loans.name: Jonalyn's Group

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 28 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Jonalyn is engaged in a dried fish vending business and earns approximately PHP1,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stock of dried fish to sell. 

Jonalyn has joined PMPC just this year. In the future, Jonalyn hopes to expand her business.  Jonalyn is the leader of a 2-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional stock of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma has been selling coconuts from her home for the last five years. She is married to a businessman, and she is also the mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase sacks of coconuts. She hopes to increase her sales activity and use future profits to ensure the fulfillment of her family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts.

loans.name: Esther

texts.fr: Esther est une femme de 52 ans, célibataire et mère de 3 enfants. elle vend, dans un quartier de la ville, le vin blanc, le bois, les biscuits, cigarettes et détergents depuis 4 ans. elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises afin de vente en quantité importante.les bénéfices ainsi générés augmenteront son capital, ouvrira une boutique et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Esther, age 52, is the single mother of three children. She has been selling white wine, wood, cookies, cigarettes and detergent in a local neighborhood for the past four years.  

She is seeking this loan to strengthen her stock and substantially increase her sales. 

The profits earned will bolster her working capital, which will help her goals of opening a store and supporting her family.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou  réside au Sénégal. Elle est divorcée et gagne sa vie par le biais de son activité de  commerce. Les produits qu’elle  commercialise  sont constitués  essentiellement de savons en poudre et de bonbon pour enfants. Cela fait plus de 20 ans qu’elle s’active dans ce secteur. Elle a déjà  remboursé  06 crédits antérieurs dans l’un des  guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle est  membre. Elle sollicite un  prêt de 300.000 francs CFA prévu  pour  l’achat de produits qui seront destinés  a augmenter  la quantité qu’elle offre a sa clientèle. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices l’aidera  toujours renforcer son fond de roulement.. Dans le futur, son projet est de pouvoir construire une maison pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou lives in Senegal. She is a divorced woman who earns a living through her commercial activity. She sells mainly powdered soap and children’s candy. She has been practicing this activity for over 20 years and has successfully obtained and repaid six loans with the U-IMCEC branch where she is a member. 

She is seeking a loan of 300,000 francs CFA, which she will use to replenish her stock of merchandise to sell. The increase in her profits will help to bolster her working capital. 

In the long term, she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy powdered soap for resale.

loans.name: Bondeni Group

texts.en:
Seen on the right with her hand raised, Rosemary is the representative for Bondeni, a group of fourteen farmers in Kakamega South District. The group is comprised of twelve women and two men. With 77,000 KES from One Acre Fund these farmers will each receive on credit enough maize and sorghum seed and fertilizer to farm one-half acre. In total, seven acres will be farmed through the One Acre Fund.

Rosemary joined the One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011 season so she could grow enough food for her family and use her increased profits to send her children to school. Prior to joining the fund, she was only able to harvest six bags of maize per acre, but after joining the One Acre Fund during Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest twelve bags.

Rosemary is now enrolling in Long Rains 2013. Her ambition is to use her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season to send her children to school and help her save for the future.

loans.use: to buy enough maize and sorghum seed and fertilizer to farm one-half acre.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
From Mwambalazi, Mwanasha sells fruits and vegetables from her home and around the village. She says she has been able to help her family by doing so and that she has given them all that they need to continue having a dignified life with no deprivations.

Mwanasha wants to be able to continue working and helping her family, so she is asking for this 10,000 KES loan from Yehu to buy more good fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
Teodoro is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Teodoro earns more income from farming rice.

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business. Teodoro has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Leonida's Group

texts.en:
Leonida is 51 years old and lives in Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. Leonida has a store and sells groceries and other consumable products and earns approximately 1,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional groceries and other consumable products for retail for her existing business.

Leonida has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. Leonida is the leader of a 2 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business. In the future, Leonida hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: Nelia's Group

texts.en:
Nelia is 52 years old and lives in Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 6 children. Nelia is engaged in a hog-fattening business and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional sacks of feed for her hog-fattening activity. 

Nelia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. Nelia is the leader of a 2 person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business. In the future, Nelia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed

loans.name: Bang

texts.en:
Bang was born in 1974. She has two children. Her daughter is learning at the 11th grade. Her son is learning at the 7th grade. Her husband is a building worker. His income is about 5,000,000 VND per month. Bang is a farmer and a wine cook. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND. She has done this job for 15 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 9,000,000 VND per month. 

Bang has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2004. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,810,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy yeast and rice for cooking wine. She wants to save profits to build her new house.

loans.use: to buy yeast and rice for cooking wine.

loans.name: Welita's Group

texts.en:
Welita is 58 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 5 children. Welita is engaged in fishing and a fish-vending business and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional fishing nets and other fishing equipment for her existing business. 

Welita has been a member of PMPC for almost 13 years. Welita is the leader of a 2 person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business. In the future, Welita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Batdorj

texts.en:
Batdorj is a 39-year-old father of two sons and lives with his family in the outer ger district which lacks the basic infrastructure of the city. In the past he has worked at a judicial decision office and then a local drilling company, but now he and the family operate a café business. Batdorj and his spouse work as chefs, while his two sons serve as waiters in addition to going to school.

Last spring the price of meat rose and they therefore had a lower profit. He is therefore requesting a loan to purchase more meat and other necessary food supplies in order to increase their profits.

loans.use: to purchase meat and other food supplies for his family cafe.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia, 60 years old, is married and has 5 children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 10 years, Alicia has run a business buying and selling firewood in the Philippines. She also earns an income from coconut wine and vegetable sales. 

Alicia has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional firewood to sell. She has previously borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF. Alicia aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood to sell

loans.name: Serge Noel

texts.fr: Serge est un jeune célibataire de 32 ans qui exerce son commerce de detail des accessoires de téléphone mobile dépuis 04 ans dans un marché de la place. son activité marche très bien . il veut un pret pour booster son stock de marchandises ainsi que les ventes et par conséquent engendrer les bénéfices suplementaires  qui sera re investi dans son activité toute en privillegiant le rembousement du crédit. ses ambitions sont celles de la vente des accessoires de téléphone et le dépannage VIP  pour assurer les meilleurs conditions de vie familliales.
texts.en:
Serge, age 32, is a single man who has been selling mobile phone accessories at a local market for four years. 

He is running a successful business and now wishes to obtain a loan to stock up on merchandise and bolster his sales. This will help to increase his profits, which he will use to repay the loan and reinvest in his activity. 

His goals are to focus in the sale of mobile phone accessories and VIP support to ensure the best living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories and parts for sale and repair.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 46 year old mother from the Kapune area of Kilgoris town. She is married and has four children. Esther is a small-scale farmer; she has been in this business for the last 20 years and comfortably earns a monthly income of Kes 40,000. She is applying for her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more farm inputs and pay labourers for ploughing. She will use the anticipated profit to grow her business into a larger operation. Her dream is to grow her business and earn extra income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay labourers for ploughing.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi established her own business from which she gets income for her household. She has decided to request a loan for KES 30,000 to stock up on cashew nuts and purchase sacks of cashew nuts. This investment will help her to increase sales and her income. This is because she has seen greater customer demand. Her plan is to make her business grow in order be able to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit runs a farm. She keeps livestock which currently includes two cows, 20 chickens, two lambs and two mother pigs. She also cultivates wheat and barley.  As a mother of two children, Lilit works hard to sustain the livelihood of her children and cover the family's basic costs. It is very difficult for her to save money for purchasing seeds for cultivation for the next season. So she has applied for this loan to pay for wheat and potato seeds. This will enable her to expand the cultivation and gather more harvest.

Lilit lives in Haykavan village of Shirak region with her husband and two children. Her husband helps Lilit to sell the gathered harvest and sustain the family. The loan is very important for Lilit and her family because for them agriculture is the sole source of income.

loans.use: to pay for wheat and potato seeds.

loans.name: Jelevasio

texts.en:
Jelevasio is 32 years old. He is from Nyahururu and is married with three children who are aged between seven and two years old.

Jelevasio has a transport business that he has been doing for the past six years and has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy a plot of land that he will use to build a house for his family.

He hopes to see his transport business expand in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 26 years old. He is married and lives with his wife in Kutaisi district, West Georgia. George is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, he has 15 bee-hives with bee-colonies and sells honey. Besides, George has a vineyard with 250 samples of vine trees. He produces wine and Georgian vodka to sell locally. 

George requested a loan to purchase an additional five bee-hives with bee-colonies. He will be able to increase the production of honey. This will increase the income of their family. With the increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase five bee-hives with bee-colonies.

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en:
Ganbat is a 36-year-old man who lives with his family in the outer ger (a type of wooden dwelling) district of Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. He has a son who attends secondary school. His wife works as a technologist while he works at a local private company. 

His previous loan was disbursed to purchase housing materials but now he is requesting a 700,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase a PC and home appliances.

loans.use: to purchase a PC and home appliances.

loans.name: Bintirashid

texts.en:
Bintirashid is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She buys and sells potatoes at the market. She requested a KES 15,000 loan to expand to cashew nuts and to buy additional sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

She has been in this business for two years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Alawiya

texts.en:
Alawiya is 43 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Alawiya is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Alawiya has been pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear and frozen foods.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa, a food market operator, previously received a Kiva loan which she used to purchase bundles of wheat flour, vegetable oil, and baking powder for her dumpling-making business, expanding the possibility that new customers might come to her establishment, and this is exactly what happened.

Today she is very happy and for this reason she is applying for a new Kiva loan. With the new loan she will buy supplies for food preparation, such as rice, meat and oil. With this purchase she hopes to gain discounts for purchasing in cash and in greater volume, thereby reducing her costs and increasing her profits.

Since receiving her Kiva loan she has had a greater influx of customers and she has improved her family income. She says to her Kiva lenders, "Thank you for permitting me to improve my business."

loans.use: to buy supplies for food preparation, such as rice, meat and oil.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 35 years old and lives in Ibabao, Aloran Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Nilda has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to  purchase more stock for her general store. 

Nilda has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Nilda hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 34 years old from Nyahururu. He is married with three children who are aged between seven and one year old.

Joseph is a farmer and has been in this business for many years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy seedlings and fertilizers to use in his farm.

He hopes to see his business expand in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 46 years old and is from Nyandarua South. She is married with five children aged between 18 and eight years old.

Hannah has an electronics shop that she has been running for the past nine years and has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy aerials, adapters etc to add to her stock.

She hopes to improve her family's standard of living in the near future and also see her electrical shop expand.

loans.use: To buy aerials and adaptors.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea is a 52-year-old married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has five children. The oldest child is 31 while the youngest is 15. She engages in a food-vending business. She sells home-cooked foods. Aside from food-vending, she also operates a mini-variety store. She sells soft drinks, chips, seasonings and soaps. She has been in both business for five years. Her husband is operating a motorcycle transport business. 

She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP  to buy rice, meat and other groceries. In the future, Irenea would like to expand her business to support her family and at the same time to able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, and other groceries.

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is 19 years old. She lives with her brother and parents in Khoni district. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have two milk cows, whose milk is used to make cheese products. They sell the cheese products in an open market at a good price locally. Along the agricultural activities, the family is also involved in a poultry-raising business. They raise and sell chicks locally. 

Natia is known as hard working young woman. She requested a loan to purchase the feed for the chicks. After the chicks are fattened properly they will be sold at better price. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income, Natia will provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the chicks.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is taking out a third Kiva loan of KES 40,000. With the loan, she wants to establish another business of printing stationery. 

Fatuma requires a loan to buy additional photocopier cartridges, paper files and envelopes. She hopes that this loan will help the business by improving her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional photocopier cartridges, paper files and envelopes.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 45 years old. She is from Nyahururu and is married with four children who are aged between 25 and 18 years old.

Serah has a cereal-selling business, which she has been running for the past seven years. She has applied for her fourth loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy maize, beans, rice, and wheat flour.

She hopes to expand her business to wholesale.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans, rice, and wheat flour

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a mother and entrepreneur. She is 55 years old and her spouse is a farmer. They have two children. The eldest is working in a restaurant while her youngest is in high-school education. To supplement her spouse's income, Pacita sells grocery items in her small store. She also raise hogs to re-sell for a profit. Together, they generate income for the family. 

Pacita is a business-minded woman that is why she keeps on gaining good profits from her businesses. She has insufficient fund to buy more merchandise that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy canned goods, biscuits, eggs to sell. She will also buy feed and medicines to sustain her hogs. 

Good income from the business will help her achieve economic stability. She hopes to keep extending her good products and services too.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, eggs, and hog feed too.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia works hard to support her family. Antonia is married and has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines.

Antonia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Antonia has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Antonia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
She works selling fruits and green vegetables. She sells from a qualified location that is good for her commercial activities and little by little she has acquired customers who prefer her because of the quality of her products, her reasonable prices, and above all for her quick service. 

She is an active woman, an entrepreneur, who is dedicated to her work and with many goals that she desires to achieve. She is working hard to obtain a more prosperous future. She feels very content with the greengrocery but she knows that she needs to make it grow in order to improve her living standards. 

In the last few weeks she increased her sales so she wants to complete a large investment in the purchase of the supplies necessary for her business. Because of this she is seeking a loan that will allow her to buy green vegetables and fruits.

loans.use: to buy green vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Markos

texts.en:
Markos is 25 years old and in engaged in agriculture. He keeps livestock which currently includes 13 lambs, 9 chickens and 5 cows, and he also cultivates wheat. Despite his young age, Markos is a very hardworking and proactive man who works hard to gather a high income and sustain his family. 

Markos lives with his family which consists of his mother, father, two sisters and a brother. Markos is very excited about developing his agricultural business so he has applied for this loan. With the loan's help Markos will purchase seeds for cultivation and will cover fuel costs. The loan is very important for him to pay for transportation costs and be able to take his products to the city markets for sale.

Markos wants his family to live in appropriate living conditions, so he works hard to ensure that he can give a better life to his family.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and to cover fuel costs.

loans.name: Genelita

texts.en:
Genelita is 38 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Genelita is engaged in a sea-food vending business, particularly crabs and shrimps, and also in a direct selling business. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional crabs and shrimps to sell. 

Genelita has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Genelita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional crabs and shrimps to sell.

loans.name: Kang

texts.en:
Kang has just paid off his loan and he decided to take another loan because he aims to improve his home, keep his family healthy, and make their lives more comfortable. This will be his second times with HKL as well as with Kiva. 

With the loan, amounting to USD 1,000, Kang is going to have his kitchen and bathroom built. Kang is now 50 years old and a father of five children, living in Samraong Tong, Kompong Speu. His business ambition is to develop his farming business in order to have a plentiful harvest in each season.

loans.use: to have his kitchen and bathroom built.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic, 40, resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Ruel and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. Marivic works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses, and has been in this business for twenty three years now.

Marivic operates her family business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and sell them with a little profit. Her products are kids clothing and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 17,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items like kiddie long and short dresses, shorts and other clothing for kids needed for her business.

Marivic hopes that her business will get bigger. She dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock like dresses, shorts and other clothing for kids needed in her business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a hard working entrepreneur who has a store near her house in Voi, Kenya. Christine buys and sells cereals, and she has been in this business for 3 years. She is 32 years of age, married with two children, both of whom are in school. She spends a lot to pay for school fees though she does not regret it because it is part of improving her children's living standards.
 
She has approached with a loan request amounting to Ksh. 50,000 to buy 15 sacks of maize and 3 sacks of beans to restock her stall. She hopes to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of maize and 3 sacks of beans to restock her stall

loans.name: Ednamay

texts.en:
Ednamay is 35 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with 6 children. 

Ednamay is engaged in fish vending business and earns approximately Php 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional boxes of fish to sell. 

Ednamay has been a member of PMPC for almost 6 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Leonila's Group

texts.en:
Leonila is 60 years old and lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. 

Leonila is engaged in chocolate tablet and coffee making business and earns approximately Php 10,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional kilos of cacao and coffee seeds for her business. 

Leonila has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business. Leonila is the leader of a 2 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: purchase additional supplies of cacao and coffee seeds

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is a patient and hard working mother. She is 52 years old, and has five children, three of whom are attending school and in need of sustenance. 

Anastacia sells grocery items to the people in her village. She patiently attends to her customers needs when they come to buy merchandise in her store. She is aiming for business progression and to achieve it, she needs to increase her merchandise. From this, she is asking for a loan of P 35,000 to invest in buying more items to sell. She will buy noodles, biscuits, eggs, soft drinks, soap and shampoo to sell. 

With the help of this loan, she will conveniently offer good products and services and gain more sales and profits as well. Additional revenue will be saved for educational expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy noodles, biscuits, eggs, soft drinks, soap and shampoo to sell in her store

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 38 years old, she is married to Solomon and they have three children who are 19, 18 and 14 years old respectively.

Esther sells second hand clothing.  She has been operating this business for the last three years, and she comfortably makes a monthly income of KES. 32,000.

She is taking her first loan with KADET LTD which she will use to purchase bales of second hand clothes. She will use the anticipated profit to expand the business by buying more bales for wholesale prices. She has a dream of opening a salon and boutique.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second hnd clothes

loans.name: Qristine

texts.en:
Qristine is 37 years old. She lives with her husband Suren (in the photo) in Ajabaj village of the Syuniq region.
Together with her husband, Qristine keeps 5 cows that give milk and uses it in cheese production. Suren sells the cheese in local markets and gets some income but it is hardly enough for covering the family's costs.
Their only income comes from selling the cheese so Qristine is very excited about increasing the livestock with a heifer and a cow. She has applied for this loan to purchase a heifer and a cow, which will enable her to make more cheese and sell it.
The loan is very important for Qristine and her husband to allow them to earn a higher income and sustain their living.
Qristine awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a heifer and a cow to increase her cheese production from their milk.

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
Catherine is 45 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 1 child.
Catherine is engaged in s cosmetics and direct selling business and earns approximately PHP 1,500each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks of cosmetics to sell.
Catherine has been a member of PMPC for almost 4 years. In the future, Catherine hopes to expand her business. Catherine is the leader of a 2 person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a 30-year-old businessman who is married to Jenniffer. They are blessed with one child. He has been running a retail shop for the past seven years with a monthly income of KES 27,600, which he uses to support his family. 

Benson is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD. He will use the loan to buy sugar, rice and flour. He will plough the expected profit from the business back into the business. 

His hopes and dreams are to expand his business and buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and flour

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 20,000 to boost her charcoal selling business. With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks charcoal for resale. Despite the challenge of the high cost of transportation, Mwanakombo believes the business has a future and besides her getting the income to educate her children, she looks forward to owning a charcoal wholesale shop in future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is married with two children. Felix is 48 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Felix owns a rice field to earn a living. He has been doing this for 30 years. He has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers for his rice fields.

Felix has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Felix hopes to expand his rice field.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Kakhaber

texts.en:
Kakhaber, 42 years old, lives with his wife and father in Tskaltubo district. His father is provided with a retirement pension, while Kakhaber purchases fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices to resell at higher prices in Tskaltubo district. As well, the family has two cows whose milk is used to produce cheese sold locally at a good price.

Kakhaber has requested a loan to finance some renovation work in his house. When it is complete, the family will enjoy better living conditions and, after hard days of work, will be able to spend evenings in a better, more comfortable home.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine runs a charcoal-selling business and requested another Kiva loan of 50,000 KES to establish a soap-making business and buy detergent products. She has been in this business for more than four years and is thankful for the improvement of her living conditions. She believes that the financial assistance will help her business. In the future, she will be successful as she continues to work hard.

loans.use: to buy detergents for soap making.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en: Avtandil is 58 years old. He lives with his wife and a grown son in the village of Supsa. The family earns a living through agriculture. In particular, they have a plot of land where nuts and maize are grown. The harvested products are sold locally. Avtandil is a very hard working man. Along with his agricultural activities, Avtandil works as a doctor locally and gets a monthly salary. Avtandil is trying to expand his agricultural business and needs money to buy kiwi saplings and plant them. In a couple of years, Avtandil will harvest the kiwi. His sales of harvested products will increase and it will positively influence the income of the family. With the increased income, he will be able to improve their living conditions. Avtandil is hoping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase kiwi saplings to plant

loans.name: Marusya

texts.en:
Marusya is a 37-year-old married woman who lives with her spouse and daughter in a ger, a traditional felt tent, in an area which lacks the basic infrastructure of the city. Her daughter attends high school, while her spouse works at a local construction company.

Marusya supports her family by operating a vegetable stall business at the largest outdoor market of Ulaanbaatar city. Currently she has about 2 million MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) in working capital. She has requested this loan to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sieng

texts.en:
Sieng is 35 years old and a loving father of two school-aged children. He is married to a local woman who is in the same type of farming business. Being a good father, Sieng is very passionate about supporting his family and aspires to having a comfortable lifestyle. He works together with his wife on their own farm, where they particularly grow rice for food. He also devotes his time to being a paid worker for extra wages in addition to his farming activities.

Sieng’s house is currently under construction so he needs more capital to have it finished. In this regard, Sieng would like to obtain a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase materials needed for the construction and to pay for the performance costs. He believes that he can live with his family happily after his house has been completed.

loans.use: to purchase materials to finish building his house and to pay for performance costs.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is 55 years old, married and has 10 children, one of whom is in school.

Cornelia is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Cornelia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Cornelia has been farming vegetables for 10 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Cornelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ramela

texts.en: Ramela is 37 years old and has two children. She lives in the village of Davit Bek in Armenia's Syuniq region, where she is a teacher at the local school. Together with her job at the school, Ramela is also involved in agriculture. She keeps four cows, seven sows and twelve bee colonies. Her salary as a teacher is hardly enough to cover her family's costs, so agriculture helps Ramela maintain a stable income and sustain her family. Ramela has applied for this loan to purchase a cow, a heifer and livestock feed. This loan is very important; it will allow Ramela to develop her agricultural business and to ensure better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, a heifer and livestock feed.

loans.name: Lenkoko Ologolimot

texts.en:
Lenkoko has cleared his loan and is now preparing for a new planting season. He has since leased a bigger piece of land on which he will diversify to maize and wheat farming.

He is applying for his fourth loan of KES 60,000, which he will use to prepare the land and buy seedlings and fertilizers.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to better the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to prepare the land and  buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married and has eight children. She is 45 years old and lives in Kinangay Sur, Clarin. Mis. Occ., Philippines.

Josephine sells a variety of products to earn a living. She has had this business for 15 years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this work. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, etc. Josephine has been a member of PMPC for three months. In the future, Josephine hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Chacha

texts.en:
Chacha is a widow with one child living in Likoni. She sells charcoal in the market. With the proceeds she has been able to pay school fees for her child.

She realizes the harmful effects her business has on the environment, and her desire is to acquire enough profits to venture into other safe energy sources like solar. Chacha intends to use the loan to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ma.magdalena

texts.en: Ma. Magdalena is a 47-year-old married woman from Cortes, Bohol. She is a mother of a 16-year-old daughter. She runs a retail store in the community. She sells commodities such as powdered milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, seasonings and toiletries. Aside from operating a retail store, Ma. Magdalena raises hogs. She works hard to earn a living. She has been in the hog-raising business for eight years.  She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional piglets, feed and pig supplements to produce healthy pigs. In the future, Ma. Magdalena would like to expand her business to support her family as well as to save for the college the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and pig supplements

loans.name: Nziyas Group

texts.en:
Karoli is a member of Nziyas Group in Kakamega south District. He is pictured with nine One Acre Fund farmers: four women and five men. Karoli is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Karoli first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2009 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Karoli joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, and because they give humble service and their price is cheap compared to others.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Karoli was only able to harvest five bags of maize per acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, he was able to harvest 15 bags per ½ acre! He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and perhaps invest in another business. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Karoli’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 4.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Tugeme Group

texts.en:
Gladys, who is in her late 30s, is married and has three children who go to school. For three years now, Gladys has been running two different business activities: selling drinks (beers and spirits) and raising broilers. She is really hardworking. She works from 8am to 5pm daily and is able to make a very good profit per month. 

This will be her seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy a TV, to buy a plot of land where she started building a house, to pay household expenses, and to pay school fees. She has paid back all of her loans successfully. She will use this loan to buy more drinks. Her dream is to one day be able to sell more beers. 

She will share this loan with her loan group Tugeme, which totals 14 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Emma works hard to support her family. She has a food production business in the Philippines and earns additional income at a cafeteria. 

Emma is borrowing 18,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy ingredients and utensils for her food production business.

Emma has sustained her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to build a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils for her food production business.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita, 49, is married with eight children, seven of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Juanita has a trisikad transportation business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy an additional trisikad.

Juanita has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional trisikad.

loans.name: Valeriane

texts.en:
Valeriane is from the village of Argveta, West Georgia. He is 43 years old and lives with his six-year-old son, who goes to the local school. Valeriane’s wife lives and works abroad to help her family financially. 

The only source of income for the family is a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. Part of the cheese produced is sold locally and the rest is used by the family. 

Valeriane has requested credit to start a family business. He wishes to purchase a minibus to transport construction materials and start a trades business. He will purchase building materials at wholesale prices and sell them for a profit at the local open market. He will also work on orders. 
Starting this business will significantly increase the family’s income. They will be able to purchase additional household goods to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus to transport construction materials

loans.name: Rosario's Group

texts.en:
Rosario is 50 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children.
 
Rosario has a store and sells groceries and other consumable products and earns approximately 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing consumable products.

Rosario has been a member of PMPC for almost four years. In the future, Rosario hopes to expand her business. Rosario is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To be used to purchase consumable products for the store.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. She is widowed woman and has a rope-making business in the Philippines.

Lolita requested a 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for making rope.

She has been in this business for 38 years.

In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her rope making.

loans.name: Marife Group

texts.en:
Marife is married and has two children. She is 34 years old and lives in Pantaon, Ozamiz City. Her business is food vending. She sells dinugu-an, kare-kare, and other foods, to earn a living. She has had this business for one year.

Marife has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase ingredients for her foods. She has been a member of PMPC for one year.  Marife is the leader of her group, and each member has her own business. Marife hopes to expand her business, in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the dishes she will sell, like meat, carrots and onions

loans.name: Fresia

texts.en:
Fresia is a single woman with no children. She stays at a family house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

With the loan, she has started a charcoal selling business; she sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Fresia faces a major challenge of price fluctuation. During the rainy season, the availability of charcoal for sale is lower compared to the hot dry season, when the availability of charcoal is higher.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is married and has two children. She is 54 years old and lives in Makawa, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To earn a living, Candelaria has a hog-fattening business. She has had this business for 13 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 12,000.

She has requested a loan to purchase more feed for her hogs. Candelaria has been a member of PMPC for 13 years. She hopes to have more savings in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more feed for her hog-fattening business.

loans.name: Zingatia Group

texts.en:
Anitha, who is in her early 40s, is married. She has three adult girls, who are already married. Since 1997, Anitha has been running two businesses, decoration and catering. She works from 8:00 A.M. to midnight daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Anitha used the previous loans to buy serving dishes, a big hotpot for food storage, decoration materials, chairs, a TV, a deck, and a fridge, and she has repaid all of her loans successfully. She will use this loan to buy decorative lights, so as to improve her business with quality items. Her dream is to be able to become involved in international business one day, with her decoration activities.

Anitha will share this loan with her borrowing group, Zingatia. The group is comprised of 11 members in total, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy decorative lights, for use in her decoration and catering business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is grateful for her first loan, as it helped her to increase the money she makes from her fruits and vegetables stall in the local market. She is applying for a subsequent loan in the amount of 50,000 KES from Yehu to pay the fees for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 44 years old and married with four children. She is a hardworking businesswoman.

For the past three years Meriam has operated a trisikad, or trishaw, in the Philippines. She is applying for a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for it.

Meriam’s ambition is to save enough money to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her trisikad.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia, a widow, works hard to support her family. She has a clothes tailoring business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from upholstery and food vending businesses. Alicia is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her tailoring business.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to use in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is a hardworking entrepreneur who for the past two years has run a business selling rice. She earns additional income by raising pigs for slaughter and selling firewood.

Through her own effort and with the help of NWTF loans Noemi has been successful in her business. She is now applying for a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to pay for more rice and meet the salaries of the laborers who work in her rice mill.

Noemi’s ambition is to build and expand her business so as to secure a good future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for more rice and her laborers' salaries.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a 25-year-old, married man. He is the father of a two-year-old child, and he lives in Bohol, Philippines. He has engaged in a motorcycle transport business for more than two years. This is the source of his income.

Benjamin is asking for a loan to buy additional spare parts for the motorcycle, like tires, nuts and bolts, and fluids. With these items in stock, he will be able to maintain the good working condition of his motorcycle. Benjamin hopes to make his business a success in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts for the motorcycle, like tires, nuts and bolts, and fluids

loans.name: Shisese Group

texts.en:
Violet’s group has 10 farmers and is located in the Kakamega south district. Violet is pictured on the right of Shisese Group with her hand raised. Violet is pictured amongst the 2 men and 8 women of her group. She will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and maize. Violet first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Violet joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and because it is time to planting.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Violet was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize per ½ acre, but after joining the One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 14 bags per ½ acre! She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and use any surplus to repay her loan. Violet’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 5 acres of maize and sorghum.

Gabriel chose to drop from Shisese Group after the Kiva photo was taken.  He is still pictured above.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum

loans.name: Twende Kazi Group

texts.en:
Festus is pictured on the right, with his hand raised, amongst the members of Twende Kazi Group. The 10 of them, 6 women and 4 men, are farmers in Kakamega South District. Farming inputs will be delivered to Festus and the others on credit. The inputs consist of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. Festus first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2009 Long Rains, and he is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Festus joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, and to use the increased profits to send his children to school.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Festus was able to harvest only two bags of maize per acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2009, he was able to harvest five bags per ½ acre! He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and to save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each member of Twende Kazi Group will receive ½ an acre worth of agricultural inputs, on credit. In total, these ten farmers will receive five acres' worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
This is Long. She is 33 years old and is married with two children who utterly rely on her care. Long did not complete her education due to her family’s financial constraints at that time. That’s the reason she had to start her family at a very young age. Farming has been the major source of her income. She and her husband own and cultivate on a few pieces of farmland. They realized that the income from farming is not really enough to cover their daily expenses. It has been a tough time for the family and that has encouraged her husband to be involved in the construction field. 

All her family members are living in a small house and it is very difficult and uncomfortable for them.
