texts.en: Merceditha is married and has four children, who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Merceditha is 45 years old and has a general store in the Philippines. She has applied for a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks to sell, including snack foods, soap, eggs, sugar and coffee. Merceditha has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Merceditha would like to save enough money so she could afford for her children to finish college.

loans.use: to buy stocks to sell in her store, including snack foods, soap, eggs, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Cherry is borrowing PHP 13,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy more fish to sell to customers. Cherry has sustained her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en: Rona is 31 years old and married. Rona is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Rona requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Rona has been in the pig-fattening business for a year now, and she has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business. In the future, Rona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pig-fattening business.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma is 60 years old and married. Thelma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Thelma requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pig. Thelma has been raising pigs for nine years, and she has borrowed from NWTF 17 times to sustain the business. In the future, Thelma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her business raising pigs.

loans.name: Charina

texts.en: Charina is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like blouses, pants, slippers and school supplies. Charina successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is relisting Charina's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as blouses, pants, slippers and school supplies.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Estrella works hard to support her family.

She buys and sells nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) as a business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending and a general store. Estrella is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional stock of nipa to sell for her business.

Estrella has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of nipa (woven palm mats) to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a fruits and vegetables retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Delia is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegatables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn works hard to support her family. Rubelyn is married and has a buying and selling of rice business in the Philippines.

Rubelyn requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional rice to sell.

Rubelyn has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Rubelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional rice to sell.

loans.name: Dioqueta

texts.en:
Dioqueta is 59 years old, married and has nine children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Dioqueta has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Dioqueta requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Dioqueta has been in this business for five years. In the future, Dioqueta would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma, who is married, works hard to support her family. For five years now she has been operating a business making and selling jewelry in the Philippines.

Gemma has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her enterprise. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her jewelry.

loans.name: Ma Gloridalma

texts.es:
La señora  Gloridalma tiene 38 años, es casada, tiene 4 hijos, reside junto a su familia en una comunidad rural del   Municipio de Arizona, departamento de Atlántida.
Hace 9 años inicio su negocio de venta de productos de la canasta básica familiar. Ella decidió establecer éste negocio con el ánimo de conseguir ingresos económicos para apoyar a su familia.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de más inventario como ser: pan, carnes, granos básicos, medicamentos de uso común, churros, golosinas, huevos, refrescos y condimentos.
Gloridalma se muestra satisfecha con el desarrollo de su negocio ya que las utilidades que obtiene le permiten crecer y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Gloridalma, age 38, is married and has four children.  She lives with her family in a rural community in the Arizona municipality in the Atlántida department.

She started her business of selling basic needs products nine years ago.  She decided to establish this business with the thought of getting income to help her family.

She is currently requesting a loan for 10,000 lempiras to buy more inventory like bread, meats, basic grains, common use medications, churros, candy, eggs, soft drinks, and condiments.

Gloridalma is happy with the development of her business because the profits that she gets allow her to grow and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more inventory like bread, meats, basic grains, common use medications, churros, candy, eggs, soft drinks, and condiments.

loans.name: Nury Lizeth

texts.es:
La señora  Nury tiene 34 años, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, reside junto a su familia en una comunidad del   Municipio de Tela, departamento de Atlántida.
Inicio su negocio hace 4 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos de manera ambulante y en su vivienda.
Debido al alto costo de la vida, Nury decidió obtener otros ingresos a través de la venta de ropa y así apoyar económicamente a su hogar.
Con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y aprovechar la época de verano decidió solicitar un préstamo por la cantidad de 17,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de pantalones, camisas, camisetas, short, calzonetas y ropa interior, maquillaje, cosméticos y perfumes.
Nury se siente motivada con su negocio ya que sus ingresos le sirven para apoyar a sus hijos en la educación escolar.
texts.en:
Nury, age 34, is married and has two children.  She lives with her family in a community in the Tela municipality in the Atlántida department.

She started her business four years ago.  She sells clothes and cosmetics in an itinerant manner and at her house.

Due to the high cost of living, Nury decided to get other income by selling clothes.  This way she helps her household financially.

In order to increase sales and take advantage of the summer season, she decided to request a loan for 17,000 lempiras.  She plans to use the loan to buy pants, shirts, t-shirts, shorts, bathing suits, underwear, make-up, cosmetics, and perfume.

Nury is motivated by her business because this income serves to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, t-shirts, shorts, bathing suits, underwear, make-up, cosmetics, and perfume.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Delia works hard to support her family. She has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Delia is borrowing 14,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of purified water to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene works hard to support her family. Arlene is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a 19,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business like linen, tailoring chalk, etc. Arlene has been in her business for five years now. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business like linen, tailoring chalk, etc.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 43 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Julita has a recycled materials business in the Philippines. Julita requested a 13,500 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase recycled materials like plastic, cans and used papers.

Julita has been in her business for four years. In the future, Julita would like to save enough money to build a variety store.

loans.use: to purchase recycled materials like plastic, cans and used papers.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is 61 years old, married and has five children. She is in an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Jacinta requested a 23,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock. Jacinta has been raising pigs for ten years now and has borrowed 26 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Jacinta would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Ma. Socorro

texts.en:
Ma. Socorro, 49, is married and has six children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Socorro has a buying and selling kasoy seeds (cashew nuts) business in the Philippines. 

Ma. Socorro requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of kasoy seeds to sell. 

Ma. Socorro has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ma. Socorro would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of kasoy seeds to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling used clothing.  

Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 27 years old and married. She has three children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Emily has been farming vegetables for three years and also earns additional income from shell craft making.

Emily is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and farm equipment.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and farm equipment.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 42-year-old widow with three children who are currently in school. Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn buys and sells charcoal and rice in the Philippines. Evelyn has been in this business for four years.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal and rice to sell.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to finish the education of her children in college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal and rice to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 37 years old and married. She has three children.

Lorna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like sardines, groceries, etc,. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Lorna has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Lorna aspires to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like sardines, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. Nelia has been in this business for 4 years. Nelia earns more income from farming vegetables, raising pigs and buying and selling coconut.

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Nelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 41 years old and married with two children. Rosita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a used clothing business in the Philippines and requested a 28,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy items like bags, pants, t-shirts and other ready-to-wear clothing. Rosita has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the used clothing business for 12 years and also earns an income from a general store.

Rosita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like bags, pants, t-shirts and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith works hard to support her family. Judith is married and has a motorcycle parts business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. Judith has been in her business for one year now. In the future, Judith would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional motorcycle parts to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 42 years old and married with two children who are in school. Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, canned goods, spices, soft drinks, etc.. Elizabeth has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, canned goods, spices, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is 49 years old, married with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gleceria has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years. Gleceria requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

 In the future, Gleceria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business

loans.name: Lyndelou

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Lyndelou works hard to support her family. She has a business selling ready-to-wear [clothing] in the Philippines and also earns additional income from direct selling Avon products. Lyndelou is borrowing 25,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase additional ready-to-wear stock to sell for her business.

Lyndelou has been sustaining her business activities with her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of ready-to-wear to sell

loans.name: Febe

texts.en:
Febe is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice and charcoal in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice and charcoal to sell for her buy and sell rice and charcoal business.

Febe has been in this business for 16 years. She earns more income from farming sugarcane and vegetables.

Febe has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ansole

texts.en:
Ansole works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

Ansole successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fish vending and general store business. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

In the future, Ansole would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 64 years old and a widow with four children. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Loreta is borrowing 14,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Loreta has been pig fattening for four years and also earns additional income from food vending. 

Loreta has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her pig fattening and food vending businesses. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling root crops in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from farming corn and sugarcane and also pig fattening.

Lorena is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of root crops to sell for her buy and sell root crops business.

Lorena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of root crops to sell.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa is 48 years old, married and has four children. She is in an agricultural business raising a cow in the Philippines. Felisa requested a 29,500 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase an additional cow and other livestock to raise. Felisa has been raising cows for 29 years now and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Felisa would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow and other livestock to raise

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 36 years old, married and has one child who is currently in school. 

Mary Ann is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Ann has been pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maphie

texts.en:
Maphie is married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 38 years old and has four children who are in school.

Maphie has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her business.

In the future, Maphie would like to save enough money so she can afford to finish the education of her children in college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 25 years old and married with 2 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jenelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance of her pig pens.

Jenelyn has been raising pigs for 6 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her pig pens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin is a 34-year-old married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be a visionary and honest man. He operates a retail store where he sells household items such as soda, flour, maize flour, etc. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. His business is located at an urban area and his primary customers are daily consumers and local residents within the area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity within the area. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy household products to sell. His business goal is to open another similar retail store within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his business. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy household products to sell

loans.name: Brigda

texts.en: Bridga is a 36-year-old married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 7 years. She describes herself to be a hardworking and caring woman. She operates a tailoring retail store where she sells dresses, skirts, suits, etc. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located at an urban area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fabric for making dresses and suits to sell. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a wholesale tailoring business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make dresses and suits to sell

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en: Kibibi is married and has three children. She describes herself as a focused woman. She operates a retail business where she sells firewood. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She says her biggest business challenge is a shortage of firewood to sell. She will use the loan of 80,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy more firewood to sell. Her business goal is to run a bigger business selling firewood within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM after managing to pay loans of 20,000 and 50,000 KES successfully.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: Jerusha

texts.en: Jerusha is a 36-year-old married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be a hardworking and determined woman. She operates a tailoring retail store where she sells dresses, skirts, suits, etc. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located at a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fabric for making suits and dresses to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business and run another tailoring retail store within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Arlene is borrowing 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy fishing net and other fishing equipment.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Imani Group

texts.en:
Imani Group is located in Kakamega South District. It is a group of nine women and three men led by Beatrice pictured on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for half an acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. Beatrice first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains season and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Beatrice joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and access the best input prices. 

Beatrice reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about four bags of maize per 0.75 acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested nine bags per 0.75 acre! She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and invest in a cow. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive half an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Beatrice’s group will receive 5.5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is 62 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Gregoria has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. Gregoria requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Gregoria has been in this business for two years. In the future, Gregoria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Melecia

texts.en:
Melicia is married and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through Negros Women Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., to purchase more grocery products to sell at her store.

Melicia has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Melicia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to sell at her store.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a married woman. She has two children between the ages of 5 and 8. She describes herself to be a jovial and honest woman. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located at a viable business area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy clothes to sell. Her business goal is to run a wholesale business selling clothes within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will run a stable business and improve the living standard of her family. Sarah also gets some income to boost her business from her husband, who is employed as a taxi driver. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has two children who are 1 year and 3 years old. She describes herself to be a jovial, ambitious and smart woman. She operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services. She has been involved in this business for 14 years. Her business is located near a school, and her primary customers are students and the general public from the local environs. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy another dryer which will be used in her beauty salon to meet the customers' demand for hair service. Her business goal is to run a new business of a gym within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will build a permanent house. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM after taking a loan of 20,000 KES, which she repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a dryer.

loans.name: Laarni

texts.en:
Laarni is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

Laarni successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further improve her business.

NWTF is relisting Laarni's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Perseveranda

texts.en:
Perseveranda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines for four years. She also earns income from a general store.

Perseveranda, who has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF, is borrowing PHP 15000 to buy spare parts for her tricycle. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 35-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 5 years to 14 years. He describes himself to be a faithful man. He operates a van in which he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located at a viable business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to add to his savings and buy a van. His business goal is to own three vehicles within five years. He hopes that in the future he will educate his children with profits generated from the business. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. He managed to pay a loan of KES 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to add to his savings and buy a secondhand van

loans.name: Silveriana

texts.en:
Silveriana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a native hat making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy materials like buri (raffia), paint, etc. for her native hat-making business.

Silveriana successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to improve her business.

NWTF is relisting Silveriana's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like buri (raffia), paint etc. for her native hat-making business.

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia is a married and hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Verginia successfully paying back her previous loan and now is requesting a new loan for build and expand her business.

NWTF is relisting Verginia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Tharo Group

texts.en: Thethem belongs to Tharo Group. She is pictured here with her hand raised. She lives with her husband and two children in a small village in Manipur, Northeast India. Jimmy, her husband, works for a meager income in the construction of houses. In order to supplement the family income, Thethem has been running a paan dukan (corner shop) near her house. However, due to lack of capital, she was not in a position to fill her shelves, so she lost some of her customer base. In order to attract more customers, she wants to use a loan to increase her shop’s stock of a variety of items including snacks, tobacco and other household essentials like matches, candles and soap. Since her eldest child will start school this year, Thethem hopes that making good use of this loan in her business will help her support this education. Moreover, she and her husband are hopeful about her venture. Likewise, the rest of the group members need a loan for their respective activities which are selling and supplying vegetables and running tea hotels.

loans.use: to buy materials and items for a paan shop

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. She describes herself as an honest woman. Sofia operates a restaurant where she sells food, tea, and snacks; she has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents, but her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business. Sofia will use her loan 30,000 of Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy ingredients for preparing the food at her restaurant. 

Sofia also has rental houses which provide accommodation and increase her business income. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing meals to sell.

loans.name: Shikuye B Group

texts.en:
Shikuye B is a group of 41 farmers in Kakamega South District. The group has 30 women and 11 men and is represented by Alphonce. Alphonce is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. His credit will cover the necessary farming inputs (seed and fertilizer) to plant a half acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. Alphonce joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2007, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Alphonce joined One Acre Fund so that he could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and use increased profits to send his children to school.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Alphonce was only able to harvest five bags of maize per 3/4 acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, he was able to harvest eight bags per half acre! He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and to repair his home. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Alphonce’s group members will take loans toward inputs for half acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 20.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is a 43-year-old married woman. She has two children and describes herself as hard-working. Pauline operates a restaurant and retail store where she sells food, tea, snacks, and charcoal. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She says her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy ingredients for preparing meals to sell. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to improve the living standard of her family. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM after managing to pay a previous loan of 15,000 KES.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food to sell.

loans.name: Hendrica

texts.en: Hendrica describes herself as a focused woman. She is married, and she operates a retail store where she sells home products such as sugar, salt, flour, etc. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a viable business area, but she feels her biggest business challenges are stiff competition within the area and high local council rates. She will use the loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy more home products to sell in her store. She hopes to run a bigger shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy household items to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with one child. She describes herself as trustworthy and determined. 

Elizabeth operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for five years. She also does farming, which increases her income. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are local residents. She says her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy vegetables and fruits to sell. Her business goal is to start a wholesale business selling household products within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to build a house for her family. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM after managing to pay a previous loan of 50,000 KES successfully.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Thamban Group

texts.en:
Thamban Group was formed by five women members who are residents of a village. The village is in Churachandpur, which is about 65 kilometres from Imphal, capital of Manipur. The state Manipur is in the northeastern part of India. Coming together and helping one another are the main reasons for the formation of the group. Their main goal is to find a way to sustain their lives and their families.

Bony is the profile member. She is standing with her right hand raised in the picture. She is 27, the mother of a son and a daughter. Both her children are going to school. Her husband carries water from the reservoir with an auto rickshaw and supplies in and around the town. This water supply task is the main source of income for her family.

Bony used to run a small shop where she sold cigarettes, tobacco products, paan (desert), biscuits, sweets, soaps and detergents and varieties of eatables. But the shop business did not run well, so she did not make much profit. Now she plans to brew local wine and sell and supply her products to different places. To start this business, she needs capital for buying rice, firewood, charcoal and yeast, which are essential for brewing.

The other members need loans too to do better with their respective income activities such as running small shops and hotels and selling vegetables.

loans.use: to buy rice, firewood, charcoal and yeast for brewing local wine for sale

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 61 years old and married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Remedios has a basket weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eleven years.

Remedios requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her basket weaving. In the future, Remedios would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her basket weaving.

loans.name: Muthee

texts.en:
Muthee is a 23-year-old single man. He has one child. He describes himself as an honest, God-fearing and focused man. He operates a retail business selling khat which is commonly sold in his town and residential area. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a viable and busy business environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds for improving his khat business.

Muthee will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling (KES) loan to buy khat to sell. His goal is to expand his business with the goal of maximizing his capital base to 100,000 KES within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy khat to sell

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is married and works hard to support her family. She has a business selling vegetables and fruits in the Philippines. Amalia is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables and fruits to sell in her food stall.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past eleven loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Good Family Grafton Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Good Family Grafton” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of 4,200,000 Leones for the entire group in order to add more inventories into their respective businesses. In this way, they will be able to attract more customers, make more sales and a better profit. Consequently, this will lead to improvement in their standard of living.
 
The leader of this group is Mariatu. Mariatu is age 30; she was born in the village of Mangekoya, in northern Sierra Leone. But she is currently residing in Waterloo, together with her husband and three children. For many years now, Mariatu has been doing a business; she sells rice, palm oil, onions, tomatoes, etc., and with her share of this loan, she is going to buy the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock..

loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil, onions, tomatoes, etc., in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 39-year-old, married woman. She has two children, ages 6 and 9 years. She describes herself as an optimistic and goal-oriented woman. She operates a retail store, where she sells plastic items such as cups, plates, etc. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located at a profitable business area, and her customers are primarily local residents. She says her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy plastic items to resell. Her business goal is to expand her business and employ at least five people in the business, within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Agnes also does livestock farming, which increases her business income.

loans.use: to buy more plastic items to resell in her store.

loans.name: In God We Trust 1 Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “In God We Trust” group from Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Leones (SLL), for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Zainab is the leader of this group. The 37-year-old is married to a businessman, and the couple has three children, who are attending primary and secondary schools. Zainab has been a businesswoman for many years, selling charcoal, firewood, and similar products. With her share of this loan, she will buy a large quantity of charcoal and firewood, to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to  buy a large quantity of charcoal and firewood, to add to her current stock

loans.name: Go On Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Go On” group from Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan of 2,600,000 Leones for the group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Salamatu is the leader of this group. The 40-year-old is married to a trader, and they have three children. Salamatu has been a businesswoman for many years now; she sells onions. She has requested this loan in order to buy a large quantity of onions to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of onions to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Go Try 1 Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Go Try” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a town in Western Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Elizabeth. Elizabeth is age 52.  She was born in the small town of Mile-Ninety-One in northern Sierra Leone. Today she is residing in Waterloo, together with her husband and 4 children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary schools.

For many years now, Elizabeth has been selling clothes. With this loan, she is going to buy bales of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes to add to her current stock

loans.name: Surprise Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadiatu was born in Koidu city, in eastern Sierra Leone, 39 years ago. She is married to a trader, and the couple has four children, who are attending schools. For eight years, Kadiatu has been selling palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), among other items.

This is the first loan that Kadiatu and her group members have applied for, from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. Kadiatu will use her share of the loan to buy gallons of palm-oil to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm-oil, to add to her current stock

loans.name: Kuyeh Dondoya Group

texts.en:
Madona is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Madona was born in Kono district, in eastern Sierra Leone, about 33 years ago. She is married to an architect, and the couple has three children – two of them in primary school, and one in college. For many years, Madona has been selling slippers, or flip-flops.

This is the first loan that Madona and her group members have applied for, from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand the sizes and qualities of their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. Madona will use her share of the loan to buy a large quantity of slippers, or flip-flops, to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of slippers, or flip-flops, to add to her current stock

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Kandal province’s Sa Ang district, Channa is 36 years old and married with one child who is still in school. She earns a living through farming rice while her husband is a motor taxi driver in the local area to earn extra income. Having been in this business for several years, Channa can earn about 10,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
This is the first loan for Channa’s group of three members. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, she wants to use her portion to build a proper latrine. She hopes to have a latrine for her family to use to make a better life.

loans.use: to build a proper latrine

loans.name: Mujeres De Suenos Y Metas 5, 6 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Aurelia is a member of the Mujeres De Sueños y Metas (Women of Dreams and Goals) 5, 6 & 7 group. This group is comprised of 15 women with small businesses who sell different products. Aurelia is a mother of one child, and she lives with her long-term partner. They live in the city of Santo Domingo. She has always worked hard to give her children what she was not able to have in her childhood.

Aurelia’s business is a Fantasia, a miscellaneous products shop. She sells different products like cosmetics and women's accessories. This is her fifth loan with Esperanza Internancional. She is very grateful because she has been able to advance and invest in her business with these loans. She will use this new loan to increase her business inventory by buying shoes, cosmetics, clothes, and other miscellaneous items.

This group is located in an area with scant resources in the city of Santo Domingo. It is to the north of the city. Aurelia and her group thank you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products like shoes, accessories, etc.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Mercedita works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a variety store. Mercedita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy utensils and ingredients for her food business.

Mercedita has been sustaining her business activities through her six previous loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of owning a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy utensils and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Lamnganbi Group

texts.en:
This group, professionally known as Lamnganbi Group, was formed in the year 2010. These five hardworking women belong to a non-tribal community and live in a small village located in Northeastern India in the state of Manipur. They believe in collective effort as a group to support one another and pave the way for a better fortune.

Musuk is the profile representative of the group, photographed with her hand raised. She is the mother of two children and has been maintaining the family affairs with the meagre income from her husband's carpentry activities. In order to supplement the family income, she decided to start working on some activities so she can earn for the family. Before the loan, she was growing vegetables for consumption in her homestead garden.

In 2010, with her first loan, she started an embroidery business to generate her income. Mainly, she embroiders the borderline of the traditional wrap-rounds. She has a sewing machine. She will use this loan to purchase thread in colours and needles for her work.  Her embroidery work has been a success and, in the course of time, she can pay back the loan.

Musuk wishes to include poultry as another activity for better income opportunity. Her interest in poultry was fulfilled after she bought chicks and ducklings and raised them. Her dream is to purchase a used mini truck, which she believes is a need for the villagers to cart all the essential goods in the village. She would charge a fixed carrier cost.

Musuk needs another loan to continue with her embroidery work and start her new poultry farm. She will use this loan to purchase chicks to raise and sell for profit. Likewise, the rest of her group members have made steady improvement and need another loan for their respective income activities such as weaving, embroidery and selling vegetables, to mention a few.

loans.use: to buy thread in colours for embroidering and to buy chicks to raise and sell for profit.

loans.name: Leng's Group

texts.en:
Leng is aged 44 years and widowed. She lives in a rural village of the Kandal province’s Sa Ang district, earning a living through farming rice on two-hectares of farmland. She can earn about 7,000 KHR per day from the current business.

Leng’s group consists of four members who live in the same village. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Leng will use her portion to buy materials to construct a latrine. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent latrine for use by her family.

loans.use: to buy materials to construct a latrine

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.ru:
Юрий – из Великой Знаменки. Он занимается выращиванием овощей на своем участке уже целых 20 лет. На данный момент Юрий выращивает помидоры, редис и огурцы на своей земле. 
Сумма в 16 000 гривен понадобилась Юрию для того, чтобы построить новую теплицу и закупить пленку, чтобы ее покрыть. Юрий давно хотел построить дополнительную теплицу, но у него не хватало собственных средств. Юрий имеет хорошее хозяйство, стабильный доход и развивается в этой сфере. В следующем году Юрий планирует делать отопление в теплицах. У Юрия пятеро детей, один из которых имеет ДЦП. Семья Юрия не унывает, постоянно стремиться развиваться и обеспечивать всех детей всем необходимым. В этом году начали строить гараж и времянку.
texts.en:
Yuryi is from Velikaya Znamenka. He has worked with growing vegetables at his plot for 20 years already. Currently Yuryi grows tomatoes, radishes and cucumbers on his land. 

Yuryi needs the amount of 16,000 hryvnia in order to build a new greenhouse and to purchase plastic film to cover it. Yuryi has long wanted to build an additional greenhouse, but he has not had enough money. Yuryi has a very good business, a stable income and is developing in this area. Next year Yuryi plans to set up heating in the greenhouses. 

Yuryi has five children, out of which one has Cerebral Palsy. Yuryi's family does not lose hart, and they always try to develop and provide all their children with everything necessary. This year they started to build a garage and a makeshift building.

loans.use: to build a new greenhouse and to purchase plastic film

loans.name: Unidas Venceremos 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Martira is the coordinator of her group "Unidas Venceremos 2" (Unite to Win). Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their two children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to live well. She wants to have a successful business and her own safe and beautiful house. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying watching television, especially Latin series.

This is Martira's 16th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and growing her business. She has had her business for almost four years, although she has been selling clothing for more than five years, starting with the loans she received from Esperanza. Now, she is running a bakery, and this loan will be used to buy flour, sugar, eggs, butter, and other goods to prepare cookies, sweets, and bread. She will use the profit to reinvest in her business. She is very thankful for your support.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, eggs, butter, etc.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 64 years old and married with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Alicia has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase paint, hardwood, and other equipment to repair her fishing boat.

Alicia has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase paint, hardwood, and other equipment to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 50 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Josephine has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Josephine has been in this business for 28 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Lilia works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. Lilia is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other equipment.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her 21 previous loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Susan successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is listing Susan's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Futuro 3, 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Luz is the coordinator of her borrower group, Trabajando para el Futuro (Working Toward the Future). This group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. Here, running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. Luz makes her home in a simple structure with her long-time partner and their four children.

Luz is excited to be taking her 17th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her cafeteria by purchasing necessary products such as bread, cheese, ham, beans, sweets (candies), and other comestible items as well as a blender.

Luz will use the profits to improve her business, to rebuild her house, and to provide for her family's needs. She dreams that her children will grow up to be good people. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy groceries and a blender

loans.name: Baigalmaa

texts.en:
Baigalmaa, 49 years old, lives with her husband and two daughters in a small house in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband Lodoisambuu works as an assistant at a local company, while her daughter Dulmasuren, age 24, helps her mother to run her organic fruit-growing and juice production business; Gantsetseg, age 11, attends a local school.

Baigalmaa, who has been growing organic fruit trees since 2005, produces organic fruit juice which she sells to local customers. Well-known among the customers, she is now requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase seeds and trees to produce more trees and increase her organic juice production.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and trees to produce more trees and increase her organic juice production.

loans.name: Holmurot

texts.ru:
Холмурод мужчина в возрасте 38 лет,живет в сельской местности.  Он женат и имеет 2 детей. Его супруга не имеет высшего образования, поэтому нигде не работает. Сам Холмурод тоже закончил только среднее образование. Он дехканин. Но то,что он зарабатывает на своем колхозе не хватает даже на проживание.  Несколько лет тому назад Холмурод решил заняться откормом скота так как этот бизнес дает очень хороший доход. Он разводит крупно рогатый скот. Покупает на рынке скота теленка и откормив продает за выгодную цену. Его жена в свободное время помогает ему откармливать скот. Дети Холмурода уже выросли и он мечтает чтобы они учились в высших учебных заведениях поэтому родители развивают свой бизнес и копят деньги на обучение детей. Ведь если они будут иметь высшее образование они смогут работать достойно  по профессии. 
На полученный кредит Холмурод планирует купить корм для скота, так как корм закончился и в зимнее время травы нет. Он очень благодарен организации Кива за финансовую помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Holmurot is a 38 year old man living in a rural area.  He is married and has two children.  His wife doesn't work because she doesn't have a higher education.  Holmurot also only finished high school.  He is a peasant farmer.  But what he earns on the collective farm isn't enough to get by on.  Several years ago, Holmurot decided to get into the business of raising cattle since this brings a very good income.  He raises cattle that he buys at the market while they are still calves.  After raising them and fattening them up, he sells them at an advantageous price.  His wife helps him in her free time.  

Holmurot's children are already no longer small and it's his dream that they study in an institute of higher education.  Because of this, he and his wife are developing their business and saving money for their children's education.  After all, if they get a higher education, they'll be able to work in dignified profession.  

Holmurot is planning to use this loan to buy livestock feed because he is out of feed and there is no forage in the winter.  He is very grateful to Kiva for the financial help and support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Maxim

texts.ru:
Максим – фермер-сельскохозяйственник из Водяного. Он занимается выращиванием овощей на своем участке уже 4 года. Максим выращивает помидоры, редис и огурцы на своем участке. В свое время он работал в Киеве, потом вернулся в село, занялся сельским хозяйством. На данный момент имеет три большие теплицы. 
Максиму понадобились дополнительные средства в размере 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить пленку, уголь, дрова для тепличного сезона, а также построить котельную и доделать одну из теплиц, строительство которой он начал ранее, но не хватило средств закончить это.
texts.en:
Maxim is a farmer from Vodyanoye. He has worked with growing vegetables at his plot for four years. Maxim grows tomatoes, radishes and cucumbers on his land. Previously he worked in Kiev, but then he returned to his village and started an agricultural business. Currently he has three large greenhouses. 

Maxim needs additional funds in the amount of 15,000 hryvnia in order to purchase plastic film, coal and firewood for the greenhouse season, and further to build a boiler room and finish one of the greenhouses. This construction he started earlier, but he did not have enough money to finish it.

loans.use: to purchase plastic film, coal and firewood for the greenhouse season, and further to build a boiler room and finish one of the greenhouses

loans.name: Enhtsetseg

texts.en: Enhtsetseg is the 41-year-old female head of a family living in a ger (traditional nomadic tent) in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her sons Enhbayar, age 21, and Davaasuren, age 19, are university students and her daughter Badamtuya, age 17, is a senior student at the local secondary school. Enhtsetseg has been selling organic dairy products in the local market for 12 years. She is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more organic dairy products from herders, which she will sell to local customers. She is a hardworking, strong, and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase more organic dairy products to sell

loans.name: Buyanhuu

texts.en: Buyanhuu is a 56-year-old widow who lives with her 2 sons in a small house in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her son Tomorchuluun is a university student, and Arsaa goes to the local secondary school. Buyanhuu has been selling organic dairy products from a rental counter at the local market since 1995. Her income has been covering the family's expenses and her son's tuition fee. She is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products to sell to local customers. She is a hardworking, well-behaved woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products to sell

loans.name: Enhjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Enhjargal is 27 years old and lives with his wife in a ger in Bayanhongor Province of Mongolia. His wife, Bolortuya, runs a clothing retail business in a local market. This borrower has been running a taxi service in town for the last five years and has built regular customers over the years. 

Mr. Enhjargal is now requesting a loan of 2,500,000 tugriks to pay his sibling's university tuition fees and dormitory expenses in the capital city. He is a hardworking and communicative man who says, "I am planning to change my car to an eco-friendly car as soon as I have saved enough money for it."

loans.use: to pay his sibling's university tuition fees and dormitory expenses in the capital city

loans.name: Ariunaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Ariunaa is 31 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (traditional Mongolian housing) in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband, Lonjid, age 27, runs a taxi service business in town. Her son, Hosbayar, age 5, goes to a local kindergarten. 

Ariunaa has been working as a saleswoman in a local market. She has built a small house and now is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase insulation material and to install a heating system in her newly built house. 

Ariunaa and her husband are hardworking and diligent people.

loans.use: to purchase insulation material and install a heating system in her newly built house.

loans.name: Ganchuluun

texts.en: Ganchuluun is 27 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger (traditional nomadic tent) in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife Battsetseg has been staying home and taking care of their daughter Gantsetseg, age 3, since her birth. Ganchuluun has been working in various fields, and now he is starting his own taxi service in town. He is requesting 4,000,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly electric/gas hybrid car to start his taxi service. He is a hardworking, reliable, and kind person.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly car to start a taxi service

loans.name: Bayarsaihan

texts.en:
Mr. Bayarsaihan is 43 years old, and he lives with his wife and three children in a house in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. His wife Oyunchimeg, age 38, runs a small tailoring service business at home. His daughter Nyambayar, age 18, and son Odbayar, age 17, are university students, and his daughter Oyunbayar, age 10, goes to a local school.

Borrower has been providing a taxi service business since 2004. He is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase spare parts, in order to run his taxi business smoothly, without sudden interruptions. He is a hard-working, energetic, and honest man.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts in order to run his taxi business smoothly, without sudden interruptions

loans.name: Dolgormaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Dolgormaa is 50 years old lives with her husband and four children in house in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband, Davaahuu, works at a local company as a treasury clerk. Her daughter Enhsaihan, age 24, is a university student; sons Buyantogtoh and Altangerel, ages 18 and 17, and daughter Buyanravjih, age 12, go to a local secondary school. 

The borrower has been growing organic fruit trees on their plot of land since 2008. She produces organic fruit juice, and sells to local customers. 

She is now requesting 6,000,000MNT to plant organic vegetables and more fruit trees on their land. She is a hardworking and diligent woman.

loans.use: to plant organic vegetables and more fruit trees on their land.

loans.name: Mamadali

texts.ru:
Мамадали мужчина в возрасте 51года.  К сожалению   он развелся со своей женой несколько лет тому назад. У него нету детей.  Живет совсем один.  Несмотря на свое одиночество он очень добрый,трудолюбивый и ответственный мужчина.  Мамадали не решился с ново женится.  Он с самого детство занимался откормом скота, этому делу его научил его отец.  Знает все преимущество этого дела.  На данный момент имеет одного теленка и дойную корову.  Он сам доит корову и каждый день по 10 литров молока  продает  соседям и знакомым. Мамадали также занимается куплей продажей скота.  Выращивание скота является единственным  доходом Мамадали. 
 На полученный кредит Мамадали планирует купить скот и откормив до весны продать за выгодную цену.  Накопив денег он хочет летом отремонтировать свой дом так как дом очень в плохом состоянии. Мамадали выражает свою благодарность организации Кива за финансовую помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Mamadali is a man of the age of 51. Unfortunately he divorced from his wife a few years back. He has no children, and lives all by himself. Despite his solitude he is a good, hardworking and responsible man. Mamadali has decided not to marry again. 

He has since childhood worked with fattening cattle, which he learned from his father. He knows this business very well. Currently he has one calf and one dairy cow. He milks the cow himself and every day sells 10 liters of milk to his neighbors and acquaintances. 

Mamadali also works with buying and reselling cattle. Cattle breeding is Mamadali's only income. For the loan, Mamadali plans to purchase livestock and fatten until spring, to sell at a favorable price. After having saved up money he would like to refurbish his house in the summer, as the house is currently in bad conditions. Mamadali expresses his thankfulness to the Kiva organization for the financial help and support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Dorjpurev

texts.en:
Mr.Dorjpurev is 26 years old and lives with his parents in a ger in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. His parents are both retired, and stay home. Dorjpurev used to run a taxi service business in town.

The borrower is now planning to start his own business of electronic goods repair in the local market.  His father was an electric engineer, and he taught his son lot, beginning as a young boy. 

Dorjpurev is requesting 2,000,000MNT to start his own business of electronic goods repair in a rented space in the local market. He is a hardworking, fast learner.

loans.use: to start his own business of electronic goods repair in a rental space in the local market.

loans.name: Doljinsuren

texts.en: Mrs. Doljinsuren is 42 years old and the head of her household.  She lives with her mother, sister's daughter and her sister in an apartment in the Dari-Eh district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her mother requires constant care so her sister's daughter takes care of her. Doljinsuren managed a small grocery store for years and has now started her own small candy shop on the rental counter of a local market in November 2012. She is now requesting 1,000,000MNT to purchase a variety of candies for her new candy shop. She is hardworking, positive and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of candies for her new candy shop.

loans.name: Davaamaa

texts.en: Mrs. Davaamaa is 42-year-old widow who lives with her 3 sons in a ger in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her sons Lhagvasuren, age 22 and Baljinnyam, age 19 are university students and Togsjavhlan, age 9 goes to local school. Davaamaa has been running an animal pelt stall in a local market since 1990. She has a lot of regular suppliers and she sells to companies at a higher price. She is now requesting 1,000,000MNT to pay the outstanding balance of her sons' university tuition fees. She is a hardworking, responsible and modest woman who has a good loan record on her previous loans.

loans.use: to pay the outstanding balance of her sons' university tuition fees.

loans.name: Galmandah

texts.en: Mr. Galmandah is 36 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children in a small house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. His wife Enhtuya is hairdresser in a barbershop. His twins Huslen and Enhminj, age 12 and daughter Namuunaa, age 6 go to local schools. Galmandah has graduated as an electric engineer and worked at various places since then. He is now planning to start his own business for electronic goods repair in a rental place and is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to purchase start-up equipment and inventory for his new business. He is a hardworking, clever and responsible man with a good loan record at XacBank.

loans.use: to purchase start-up equipment and inventory for his new business.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent is a 31-year-old married man with one child aged 5 living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He operates a veterinary drug shop where he works for at least 10 hours a day. He serves both the rural and urban community, and his business is located along a busy street. He also earns a salary from the central government as a veteran officer and this has helped in growing his business. He faces challenges of inadequate capital and customers not paying on time since his customers are farmers.

He has a personal goal of building a permanent house for his family and a business goal of opening up new outlets in other areas. Vicent is requesting a loan to buy animal drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy animal drugs to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 31-year-old hardworking married man with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He acquired his start-up capital from house rentals and farming. He opened up a retail shop for general merchandise to help him look after his family, and has been in business for five years. He dreams of building a very good residential house for his family and wants to educate his children up to the university despite a challenge of inadequate capital to meet his customers’ demands. John is requesting the loan to purchase sugar, soap and rice to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap and rice to sell.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Мавлуда   женщина  в возрасте 47 лет,очень добрая, отзывчивая и ответственная женщина.  Она замужем, имеет троих детей. Дети уже выросли и живут своими семьями. Мавлюда с мужем живут в горном районе, поэтому занимаются выращиванием скота так как в таких районах этот бизнес очень приемлем. Этим видом деятельности Мавлюда занимается с молодых лет.  Она также из шерсти овец и коз прядет пряжу и продает оптовым покупателям. В горных районах животноводство является основным доходом. Муж Мавлюды очень часто ездит в Российскую Федерацию на заработки но там он очень мало зарабатывает поэтому им приходиться развивать бизнес по откорму скота. Мавлюда очень старается делать все чтобы улучшить условия проживания. 
Она берет кредит,чтобы приобрести молодых коз и овец.  Весной скот подорожает и она надеется продать их по дороже.  Мавлюда заранее выражает свою благодарность организации Кива за поддержку в финансовом вопросе.
texts.en:
Mavluda is a 47 years old and she is a very decent, kindhearted, and dependable woman.  She is married and has three children.  Her children are already adults and they live with their own families.  Mavluda and her husband live in a mountainous region.  They raise cattle because this business is well-suited for the mountains.  In the mountainous regions, animal husbandry is people's main source of income and Mavluda has been doing this since she was young.  She also spins yarn from the wool of her sheep and goats, which she sells to wholesale buyers.

Mavluda's husband often travels to the Russian Federation to earn extra money, but it's not very much.  Because of this, they need to expand their business of raising cattle.  Mavluda is trying very hard to improve their living conditions.

She is taking out this loan in order to buy young goats and sheep.  In the spring, when cattle gets more expensive, she hopes to sell them for a better price.  Mavluda is grateful in advance to Kiva for its financial support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: El Hadji

texts.fr: Monsieur El hadji est un habitant du Sénégal. C'est un homme marié qui exerce l’activité de commerce   pour subvenir à ses besoins. Effet, il vend des chapelets dans une mosquée très fréquentée de la localité de la communauté villageoise. Il  a une expérience  de  plus de 10 ans dans ce métier.  Il est  membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où il a bénéficié auparavant de 03 crédits. Présentement, il sollicite un prêt d’un montant de 300.000 francs CFA  qu’il souhaite utiliser pour rénover sa maison qui se trouve a son village natal village où réside sa famille. Son rêve dans le futur consiste a faire une élévation  en hauteur  dans sa maison familiale et aussi acquérir un terrain en ville ou il exerce son activité
texts.en: Mr El Hadji lives in Senegal and is a married man who sells goods for a living. He sells prayer beads at a highly frequented mosque in the local community. He has worked in this field for over ten years. He is a member of one of the U-IMCEC microfinance groups and has already received three loans. He is currently seeking a 300,000 CFA loan which he wishes to use in order to renovate his home in the town in which he was born, and where his family still lives. His dream for the future is to build up his family home and also to purchase a spot in town from which to conduct his business.

loans.use: construct a building in order to renovate his house in the village

loans.name: Urnuhbileg

texts.en:
Mrs. Urnuhbileg is 34 years old, and she lives with her husband and four children in a ger (a traditional, round, felt tent) in Hovd province, in western Mongolia. Her husband, Purevorj, works at a local security company as a security guard. Her daughter Nomin-Erdene, age 13, and sons Suhbat, age 10, and Suhhuyag, age 6, go to local schools, and her youngest daughter, Amin-Erdene, goes to a local kindergarten.

Borrower has been running a taxi service business in town, since 2008. But her car has been broken for a while, so she has not been able to run her business during the past few months. She is now requesting 2,600,000 MNT to purchase spare parts for her car, to fix the problem. The loan will enable her to restart her taxi service. She is a hard-working, welcoming, and friendly woman.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her car to fix its problem, which has prevented her from engaging in her taxi service business for months

loans.name: Bayasgalan

texts.en:
Mr.Bayasgalan is 30 years old, and lives with his parents in a ger in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His parents are retired, and stay home.

The borrower has been working as driver with his own transportation company since 2006. He is now needs to replace his vehicle in order to continue his business of public transportation in town. 

Bayasgalan is requesting 5,000,000MNT to purchase a large truck for his transportation service business. 

He is a hardworking, friendly, and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase a large truck for his transportation service business.

loans.name: Davaa

texts.en: Mr. Davaa is 54 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. His wife Buzmee, age 48 is retired and stays home. His son Baljinnyam is 16 years old and goes to a local secondary school. Davaa worked at a local hospital for years and is retired. He is now planning to start his own medication business and is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase the necessary equipment for his new medication service business. He is a hardworking and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase necessary equipment for his new physical medication service.

loans.name: Enhtaivan

texts.en: Mrs. Enhtaivan is 41 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in a house in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband Davaapuntsag works as a guardsman for the local military. Her sons Tsergiinbayar, age 13 and Otgonbayar, age 6 and daughter Hulan, age 15 go to local schools.
