Enhtaivan has been running a clothing retail shop in the local market since 2002. She has gained a lot of experience and a regular customer base over the years. She is now requesting 4,000,000 MNT to purchase inventory for her clothing retail business. She is an enthusiastic, optimistic and hardworking lady.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her clothing retail business.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 40-year-old married man with four children in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a farmer for both crop growing and animal rearing, though on a small scale. He has a challenge of seasonal weather changes like drought, which affects his income as a farmer, yet having high family needs, including school fees. He is very committed toward educating his children but limited by finances. James is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his child.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 32-year-old married woman with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She has six years' experience as a farmer, and she also raises cattle, which provide milk for the family and a surplus to sell. She is a very hard-working woman who takes full responsibility for her children. Jackline faces the challenges of seasonal weather changes and price fluctuations for the agricultural products she sells. She is a very committed farmer, and she would like to modernize her methods of farming in order to realize higher yields. However, her finances are limited. Jackline is requesting a loan to buy manure and to pay the workers who are preparing her garden for the next season.

loans.use: to buy manure and to pay workers in preparation for the next season.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 24-year-old, single man who lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He sells rechargeable mobile cards. He began by opening a small business with limited capital. He is a hard-working man. Mohammed sells the cards at acceptable prices, attracting a lot of customer interest. He has many customers and they appreciate him. He also has a good reputation and good credit history. Mohammed's great experience and love for his work helped him to achieve his working capital. He plans to invest the youth loan of 100,000 (YER) in purchasing additional rechargeable mobile cards for resale. He loves his work and hopes to invest the income received from his business in its further development.

loans.use: to purchase additional rechargeable mobile cards for resale.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en: Angelica is a 32-year-old, hardworking business woman with 3 children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is a single mother and earns a living from selling clothes, working for at least 8 hours a day. She is a very honest business woman but has a challenge of inadequate capital and the problem of price fluctuations due to inflation resulting in high prices for the commodities. In the future she wants to become a whole seller and dreams of building a permanent house for the family. Angelica is requesting a loan to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Badam

texts.en:
Mrs. Badam, a 47-year-old widow, lives with her son in a ger (traditional, round, felt tent) in Uvs province, Mongolia. Her son, Olzii-Orshih, age 25, has graduated from specialty training school, and now he is planning to start his own business, providing public transportation.

Borrower has been running a small, interior construction and design business during summers, and she works as an assistant worker in a public transportation-providing business. She is now requesting a loan of 4,200,000 MNT, to purchase an eco-friendly, electric and gas-consuming car, for her son's use in his new taxi service business. Both Badam and her son are hard-working people. She has a good record with XacBank, regarding her previous loans.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly, electric- and gas-consuming car, for her son's use in his new taxi service business

loans.name: Karule

texts.en: Karule is a 38-year-old married man with six children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has run his stationery shop for 2 years and was inspired to start his business by the market that was available. His main clients are the schools and offices around the district. The purpose of the loan is to buy stationery products to sell.

loans.use: to buy stationery products to sell.

loans.name: Nyabitusi Kwetungura Group

texts.en: Fabiano is a 58-year-old married man with 5 children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is a retail shop but also sells produce in order to earn additional income. He has hardships of customers who delay to pay and price fluctuation, however his vision is to educate his children to higher levels and owning a wholesale shop. Fabiano intends to use the loan to buy salt and paraffin to sell. He is a member of the above mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy salt and paraffin to sell.

loans.name: Zabuloni

texts.en: Zabuloni is a hardworking married man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He grows cocoa and also operates a retail shop in order to meet the daily expenses of his family. The good father that he is he dreams of educating his children up to University and setting up sustainable income generating activities despite challenges of limited capital coupled with unpredictable seasonal weather. His business plan is to become a wholesaler and the leading cocoa producer in the region. Zabuloni is requesting for a loan to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Majd

texts.en: Majd is a 26-year-old man living in Ibb, Yemen. He completed secondary school but was not able to proceed further with his studies due to the difficult living conditions he faced. He has been selling ice cream, and he has been operating this business for a few months by relying upon his savings. Because he is alone and has no one to support him, Majd has done his best to improve and expand his business in order to secure his future. He has gained many customers, and he is now inspired to expand his capital and income by purchasing more of the ice cream items demanded by his clients. To do this, Majd has taken a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to purchase supplies for his ice cream business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to continue running his business successfully and make the business more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream supplies for his business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata  habite au Sénégal. Elle est veuve   et vit avec ses enfants. Elle s’active dans le secteur du petit commerce depuis plus de 12 ans et pratique la vente  de fruits (mangues, oranges, etc. et de cacahuètes. Elle est membre de  l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où elle sollicite un prêt d’un montant de 75.000 francs CFA. Ce premier crédit lui permettra de s’approvisionner en fruit en quantité suffisante pour satisfaire la demande sa clientèle. Cependant, ce prêt peut lui offrir la possibilité  d’améliorer ses revenus d’une part et d’autre part  de subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille  et supporter les charges mensuelles telles que les  paiements de s factures d’eau et d’électricité. Son rêve le plus tangible est de devenir une très grande commerçante.
texts.en: Madame Aminata  lives in Senegal. She is widowed and lives with her children. She has been working in retail for over 12 years, and sells fruit (mangos, oranges etc. and peanuts). She is a member of the U-IMCEC microfinance group from whom she is seeking a 75,000 CFA loan. This will be the first loan she has requested and will enable her to stock up on fruit in sufficient quantities in order to satisfy her customers' demands. This loan will, on the one hand, enable her to boost her business revenues and also to see to her family's everyday needs, e.g. by paying the monthly water and electricity bills. Her dream is to become a successful saleswoman.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and peanuts for re-sale.

loans.name: Enhbold

texts.en: Mr. Enhbold, 33 years old, lives with his parents in a ger (a traditional, round, felt tent) in Uvs province, Mongolia. His father is a herdsman, and his mother has retired and stays home. Borrower has been running a taxi service business in town, since 2010. Now he is planning to start a butcher shop business, and he is requesting a loan of 1,800,000 MNT. He will use this amount to purchase a large quantity of meat from herders, and will sell the meat to local meat retailers, at a higher price. He is a hard-working, positive and honest man.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of meat from herders, for sale to local meat retailers at a higher price

loans.name: Lizzy

texts.en:
Lizzy is married and a merchant who sells clothes. She lives in Kisauni, and has one child. Lizzy began selling in the marketplace thanks to the financial assistance from her husband, who works in the defense force. Gradually she was able to increase her business and now she offers her products throughout the district.

Lizzy travels to Tanzania and brings back articles of clothing, which allows her to continue offering good prices. The articles of clothing that she sells most are those for women and children such as blouses, t-shirts, shorts, sweatshirts, and lingerie. She is requesting assistance so that she can buy articles of clothing that are in season. Lizzy wants to be well-stocked with these items so that she can offer them to her customers.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing that are in season.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman and has one child who attends school.

Mwanasha owns a grocery store and has been in this business for more than nine years. In order to have the necessary capital to set up her business, she got support from her husband. In this way, she was able to set up a small grocery store which, over time, she has expanded.
Her business is strategically located near the wholesale food market which means that she gets a lot of customers and more income.

Mwanasha will use this loan to buy more merchandise (soda, milk, brandy, sugar, etc.) that will improve the range of products she sells.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (soda, milk, brandy, sugar, etc.) to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 58-year-old married man with four children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda, where he grows bananas and also has eucalyptus trees. With the proceeds from his plantation, he has been able to start a poultry farm. He also earns extra income from the monthly pension he receives since retiring from government work. The high cost of feeds and bad weather affect his business. Nevertheless, his dream is to own at least 5,000 chicks. Samuel intends to use the loan to buy chicken feeds.

loans.use: to buy chicken feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products for re-sale

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Ganchimeg is 26 years old, and she lives with her husband and three children in a small house in Dornogovi province, Mongolia. Her husband, Chinzorig, age 29, helps her to run their business of firewood and coal retailing in a local market. Her son, Anhbayasgalan, and daughter, Ariunzaya, go to local schools, and her younger son, Amarbayasgalan, goes to a local kindergarten.

Borrower has been running her firewood and coal retailing business in the local market, since 2008. She is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy an eco-friendly, electric and gas-consuming vehicle for business use, to reduce transportation cost. She and her husband are hard-working, responsible and neat people.

loans.use: to buy an eco-friendly, electric and gas-consuming vehicle for business use, to reduce transportation cost

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en: Ismail is a 42-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal. He works as an office attendant, and with his meager salary he has been able to pay school fees for his children and buy land for farming. Unfavorable weather conditions and limited finances have affected his plans. But he still dreams of educating his children up to the university level and venturing into commercialized agriculture. Ismail intends to use the requested loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in the town of Kisauni with her family. For the last several years, she has worked selling clothing and second-hand shoes. She is continuing forward in her efforts to provide better living conditions for her family.

Mariam is very happy with the support being offered by Yehu Microfinance through Kiva. She wants to invest the requested loan in a pack of clothing and used shoes, in order to take advantage of the season and hopefully earn a better income.

loans.use: to purchase a pack of clothing and used shoes

loans.name: Gladys' Group

texts.en:
Gladys is a dryland farmer, producing and selling maize, cowpeas, hens and goats. She is a thirty-year-old, married mother of six; five of her children are attending school. 

Gladys faces the challenges of drought and food shortages, like all dryland farmers. She looks forward to learning how to be a forestry farmer with the KOMAZA program. Gladys intends to continue educating her children with the money she will get after harvesting her tree farm.

loans.use: to purchase inputs such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical trainings and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regine is a 27-year-old married woman. She has been in the clothing business for the last five years. She buys clothes of different varieties from the city and sells them in her local community. She earns enough profit through her business to contribute well to the family income. Her husband is a teacher, but his income alone is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members.

Regina is a mother of three child aged seven, five and one, and is motivated to provide for her family. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Yehu Microfinance and applied for a loan of 50,000 KES. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase a greater variety of clothes in different colors and designs, taking into account the tastes and choices of her customers. In this way she will be able to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of clothes in different colors and designs, taking into account the tastes and choices of her customers.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a very hard-working person, who explains that thanks to her efforts she has been able to get ahead. The previous Kiva loan has been a big help to her and she is very grateful for it. 

Today, she comes again for a loan which she will use to supply her general store with sacks of charcoal, with which she will be able to continue offering a good variety and good prices to her clients. She is again grateful for the opportunity she is receiving because it will help her a lot.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a hardworking woman who lives with her family in Kisauni. She sells coconuts and this business is going very well. She has many customers and wants to provide better conditions in her home for her family so that they will enjoy some privileges. 

She will us this loan to buy packs of coconuts because she is getting many orders. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for the opportunity they are providing with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Dama's Group

texts.en:
Dama is fifty-one year old farmer and mother of seven. She grows maize, cowpeas and green peas. The greatest challenge to her agricultural business is pests. Dama's husband is a quarry attendant, and they are currently sending three of their children to school. 

Dama joined KOMAZA's microforestry program because she saw that her neighbor's tree farm is doing well and she is "convinced if I take care of the trees they will give me good money." With her profits from the tree farm, she plans to make some investments in a business and build a good home for her family. Dama believes in the microforestry program she is joining, saying, "KOMAZA is doing development in our village by planting trees."

loans.use: to purchase tree farm inputs such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical trainings and maintenance support.

loans.name: Zawadi's Group

texts.en:
Zawadi, meaning "present" in Swahili, is a fifty-year-old dryland farmer and mother of nine children. Zawadi has little capital for farm inputs, making her agricultural endeavors difficult to conduct on a profitable scale. 

She is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program so that she may increase her income. With the profits from her tree farm, Zawadi plans to pay her children's school fees and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm inputs such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical trainings and maintenance support.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a 38-year-old woman and is married. She has one child. She has been running a retail shop for the past two years; from this she gets her income, which she uses to support her family.

Mwanakombo is applying for her first loan with Kiva through Yehu Microfinance. She will use the loan to buy bags of sugar, rice and flour, cooking fat and other stuff to be sold in the kiosk. She will plow the expected profit from the business back into the business.

Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business and buy a piece of land as well as improving her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, rice and flour, cooking fat and other related goods for the kiosk.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married and they have eight children. Rehema has been a vendor for three years. She has a stall in the market where she sells fruits, vegetables, and novelty items. Her shop is well-stocked and she has an established customer base. She says that she started small when her children were babies and the economy was unfavorable. They get up very early to open their stall and to buy fresh produce so that they can offer good quality to all their customers.

Today she is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables so that she can continue to offer her customers a good variety and to give them what they need.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rabecca's Group

texts.en:
Rabbeca is a thirty-five-year-old dryland farmer and mother of five. Her husband is also a farmer. Their agricultural business faces the challenge of low returns. 

Rabbeca is joining the KOMAZA tree planting program so that "from the sales of trees, the life of my family will be changed." With the proceeds from her tree farm, Rabbeca is planning to educate her children and support the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm inputs such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical trainings and maintenance support.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman and has one child who attends school.

Lydia operates a paraffin-selling business. She tells us that she begins her daily activities very early in the morning and returns home very late at night. She says she has been doing this for more than two months. She has her house in one of the neighborhoods in Kisauni. 

She is requesting the loan to buy litres of paraffin, the main supply of her business.

She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance for the opportunity this gives her because the loan will be a big help to her.

loans.use: to buy litres of paraffin

loans.name: Mwenda's Group

texts.en: Mwenda is a 44-year-old peasant farmer and mother of seven children. Her husband is also a farmer and their agricultural business faces the challenges of limited land and insufficient capital to purchase fertilizers. Mwenda joined the KOMAZA microforestry program for three reasons: to plant trees, to earn more money, and to change the area environment. She plans to use the profits from her tree farm to develop other projects for income generation.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm inputs such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical trainings and maintenance support

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a 67-year-old peasant farmer and father of six. His wife is also a farmer; they keep animals and grow food crops. Their agricultural endeavors face the challenges of diseases and pests for the animals and plants, poor yields, and not enough capital to invest in medicine for the animals. 

With the proceeds from his KOMAZA tree farm, Joseph intends to purchase animals that are better suited to the local conditions and will therefore give better yields.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm inputs such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical training and maintenance support

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a person who very much wants to get ahead, which is why she approached Yehu Microfinance to request a loan. She intends to stock her shop with bags of sugar, rice, bundles of wheat, maize flour and drinks for the business. 

Mlongo has worked in her business for 2 years. She’s married and with seven children; five are adults while the others still attend school. She tries to get ahead to have a better life. She’s asking for this loan to better satisfy  her customers.

loans.use: to stock her shop with bags of sugar, rice, bundles of wheat, maize flour and drinks for the business

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
The member is a salesperson who buys and sells fish. She has her own craft where she does her fishing. Her products are then sold in Kisauni and to other buyers in different towns.

Bahati has a partner and five children, all of whom attend school. Bahati is a very hardworking woman with good business references as she has a good return rate on her business. It is also a well-known microenterprise in town. She needs the loan to buy fishing equipment and sell what she catches. Bahati is committed to meet her payments on time as well as being responsible with the loan organization.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment and tools like a fishing rod, bait, etc.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is a married woman. She has no children. She operates a retail store where she sells coconuts. She has been involved in this business for 6 months, and she previously worked as a food vendor. Her business is located in a competitive business area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds for improving the business. Asha will use the requested 20,000 KES loan to buy more sacks of coconuts to sell. Her goal is to expand the business within five years. This is her first loan with Yehu Microfinance.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of coconuts to sell

loans.name: Kahaso

texts.en:
Kahaso sells coconut products. Managing her business involves offering merchandise and accepting payments over a short or long term, which she collects each day. This type of work allows her to provide jobs to other people since she has many customers. 

Kahaso is an entrepreneur who seeks to improve the stability of her family day after day. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy a variety of products to sell. This will enable her to continue working and selling all types of products to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is married and has twelve children, four of which attend school. She has been selling fish for the past four years. She started a café where she sells all types of fish. Janet is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She creatively prepares all types of fish dishes. She is asking for this loan in order to buy fish and the other ingredients she needs for her dishes.

Janet dreams that her children will be professionals. She doesn’t want them to follow in her footsteps, as she has had to make many sacrifices in life. She wakes up very early in order to work in her café. Her work doesn’t stop on weekends or holidays. This is how she makes sacrifices so that her children do not have to work this way.

loans.use: to buy fish and the other ingredients she needs for her dishes.

loans.name: Lawrance

texts.en: Lawrence is a 36-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. In order to meet the daily needs of his family, he decided to start a produce and cattle business but also supplement the business with farming, which he has practiced ever since he was 20. Price fluctuation and limited finances hinder his business growth. His dream is to own a ranch and farm for commercial purposes. Lawrence intends to use the loan to buy beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a hardworking man who lives with his family in Msambweni. He sells fruits and this business is going very well. He will use this loan to buy packs of fruits and vegetables because he is getting many requests. He is grateful to Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for the opportunity they are providing with this loan.

loans.use: to buy packs of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en: Nyamvula is 50 years old and has three school-aged children. She owns and manages a small variety store to generate income. She aims to improve the business and increase her income to provide the family's necessities and finance the education of her children. Nyamvula had planned to acquire more stocks of bags of sugar, bundles of maize flour, bundles of wheat flour, and other items to sell, but she has insufficient capital. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of 15,000 KES to increase her inventory, in order to increase her sales and satisfy her clients. She hopes that someday the business will grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to acquire more stocks of items to sell in her shop

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Due to financial constraints, Fatuma aimed to improve her variety store to generate sufficient income. She is 34 years old and has three school-age children. She and her husband had planned to upgrade their status of living in order to educate their children and give them a better life. In this regard, Fatuma is asking for additional capital of 20,000 KES to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, beverages, maize flour, cooking fat, soaps, and seasonings to sell. She believes that this loan will enable her to improve the business and hopes that they will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, beverages, maize flour, cooking fat, soaps, and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Kyalo

texts.en:
Kyalo is married and makes a living operating M-Pesa (Mobile money transfer) service. He also sells mobile phones and scratch cards. He sells these in a commercial shop.

He is a hardworking person with many goals and dreams that he desires to be able to fulfill.  Because of these, he always makes an effort and tries to get ahead. He is requesting the loan to pay for M-Pesa money float that will allow him to have enough money to transfer.

loans.use: to pay for M-Pesa money float

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a very hardworking person who explained that thanks to his efforts, he has been able to get ahead. The previous Kiva loan has been a big help to him and is very grateful for it.

He comes again to borrow 50,000 KES to establish another business: operating a motorcycle. The loan will be used to purchase a motorcycle for providing transport as another source of income.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to provide transport

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a very hard-working person who explains that thanks to her effort, she has been able to get ahead. The previous Kiva loan has been a big help to her and she is very grateful for it.

Today, she comes again to be able to supply her general store with basic staples such as beverages, soft drinks, food products, canned goods and more, with which she will be able to continue offering good variety and good prices to her clients. She is again grateful for the opportunity she is receiving because it will help her a lot.

loans.use: to supply her general store with basic staples such as beverages, soft drinks, food products, and canned goods

loans.name: Fauzha

texts.en:
Fauzha is from Msambweni. She's a merchant and the owner of a small restaurant. She has been in this business for more than fours years, and she has become very well-known among her customers.

Fauzha's a person with a lot of enthusiasm who likes to get ahead. That's why she works so hard. She starts work very early in the morning to prepare the dishes she sells, and she returns home late at night.

She's requesting this loan to buy beverages and supplies for her dishes. This is what she most needs and uses every day.

She's grateful for this opportunity because with it she's making progress.

loans.use: to buy beverages and supplies for her dishes.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is the owner of a store where she sells all kinds of agricultural products. She has worked in this business for more than 10 years and so she already has a loyal customer base that always buys products from her.

Her husband works in livestock, buying and selling small animals and in this way they help each other to get ahead. Angelina is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person with great hopes of progressing and getting ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy plants, vegetables, and more supplies to stock her business and to be able to offer good quality to her customers.

loans.use: to buy plants, vegetables, and more supplies to stock her business

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married with five children. She lives in Mwambalazi, Kenya. She is enterprising, hardworking and committed to the goals that she has set to accomplish.

She has had a grocery store in her home and thanks to the quality, the good prices and the service, people prefer her and they have a dependable source for their purchases. She has been in the business for two years. She wants to buy more supplies so she can increase the production and thus the sales, but she does not have enough capital to do it. This is why she is requesting a loan amounting to 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sacks of potatoes and vegetables. She has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes and vegetables

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice sells cosmetics and all types of accessories. She is known in her neighborhood for her good work and her friendliness with people. She has worked at this job for years, offering her clients excellent service.

The loan she is requesting from Yehu Microfinance is for the purchase of accessories and cosmetics to sell, which will help her to continue working and earning income for her family. She is grateful for the help because it allows her to grow in her undertaking as a small business owner.

loans.use: to purchase accessories and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline has been married for a long time, and she lives in her own home in Msambweni.

She has run a hardware shop from her home for several years. She has a lot of customers because hers is practically the only hardware store in the neighborhood, and so it is very popular with the local residents. Thanks to this business, she has been able to get ahead, educate their children, maintain their home, and cover any unexpected bills.

Jackline is requesting a loan to stock her hardware store with all types of products, including tools, nails, paints, and other items. She is grateful for the help that she is receiving.

loans.use: to purchase nails, paints, and other items for her store

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 33 years old and is a hardworking entrepreneur. She is married and has two children. She lives in Mwambalazi, Kenya, with her family in her own house. School fee payments are her major monthly expenditure. She owns a kiosk shop where she sells commonly-used household goods.

Paulina has requested a loan of 15,000 KES to buy a carton of soap, bundles of wheat flour, and a sack of maize flour.

loans.use: to buy a carton of soap, bundles of wheat flour, and a sack of maize flour.

loans.name: Nian's Group

texts.en:
Nian is a 24-years-old, young Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of 3 children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Nian is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Nian has 3 years experience with the small home-based sewing and tailoring business activity. She is continuously working on improving her service to her customers. In the past she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq which she used to buy a small generator and a pattern machine. Having successfully repaid the previous loan, she is now taking a new loan. Her plan with the new loan is to improve her work area, paint it and buy some small furniture items to store her materials and fabrics; and she would also like to buy an iron and ironing board. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to improve her work area, paint it and buy to buy some small furniture items to store her materials and fabrics and she would also like to buy an iron and ironing board.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is a 46-year-old married man and the father of four children. He has been working in selling car's accessories and spare parts, in addition to changing car lubricants since March 2012. He used to work in a satellite business, but he preferred to move to a better requested business.

Murad has a big family which he has to take good care of; that's why he puts so much effort into expanding his business as much as he can.

This will be Murad's second loan cycle as an  Al Majmoua borrower. His previous loan was invested in expanding his business, and today he will invest this loan in buying a car that is necessary for his business. He will use it to transport his new products from the wholesale market to his shop, and he is planning to start passing by nearby villages to continue marketing his products, in order to increase his income.

He hopes to keep on increasing and developing his income to provide his family with the best living ever.

loans.use: To buy a car necessary for his business.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman. She has been in the clothing business for the last seven years. She buys clothes of different varieties from the city and sells them in her local community. She earns enough profit through her business to contribute well to the family income. Her husband is a businessman, but his income alone is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members.

Mwanakombo is a mother of one child and is motivated to provide for her family. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Yehu Microfinance and applied for a loan of 50,000 KES. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase a greater variety of clothes in different colors and designs, taking into account the tastes and choices of her customers. In this way she will be able to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of clothes in different colors and designs, taking into account the tastes and choices of her customers

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora lives in Msambweni. She has a very good work project and buys and sells chickens. She sells them to restaurants, diners and other entities; and thanks to the quality of her product, she is making headway.

Flora struggles to get ahead and help her family through her work. Her goal is to own a shop one day, and be able to attend to customers there.

She is requesting a loan to buy chickens, to keep up her supply and stay in business.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik is from Vanadzor town and is involved in agriculture. She breeds cattle as well as cultivates potatoes. Her livestock currently includes nine cows, 12 oxen, five chickens and seven colonies of bees.
 
She lives with her husband (in the photo), daughter and mother-in-law. Jointly with her family, Arevik runs a farm with great love and care and works hard to sustain her family. Arevik uses the gathered milk in cheese production and sells it, together with other agricultural products, in the local market. This agricultural income is hardly enough to cover the family's basic costs, so it is very difficult for Arevik to save money for covering the farming costs. She has applied for this loan to pay for forage for feeding the livestock. The loan is very important for Arevik to continue the expansion of her farm.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva is from Artsvanik village of Syunik region. She has been teaching in a local school for many years.
 
Silva lives with her husband, Hamlet, and jointly with him is involved in cattle breeding. They keep seven cows and 10 oxen. Silva collects milk, and Hamlet sells the milk and milk products in the local market. As agriculture helps them to have a stable income during the month, Silva, together with her husband, would like to increase their livestock. 

Silva has applied for this loan to pay for a cow and an ox. This would help them to gather more products, sell them and earn more income. Silva's teacher's salary is hardly enough to cover daily costs so the agricultural income is very important for her to sustain her family and live a better life.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and an ox

loans.name: Mkhitar

texts.en:
Mkhitar is from Arpy village of Vayots Dzor region. He lives with his wife, Maspyur, and son, Edvard, who is 25 years old.

Mkhitar runs a farm. He keeps a cow and 12 chickens, and he grows peach, apricot, pear, nut and apple trees. He is a very hard-working farmer and does his best to sustain his family. His wife helps him to gather the harvest and sell it in the local open markets. For Mkhitar and his family, this is the only source of income, and unfortunately he is hardly able to cover the family's costs. 

Mikhitar has applied for this loan to purchase a heifer and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan is very important for him to earn more income and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for a heifer and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Ervand

texts.en:
Ervand is from Khndzoresk Village of the Syunik region. He is 28 years old and lives with his parents. Ervand's parents are retired with a retirement pension, so Ervand is the only breadwinner in the family. He owns a farm which currently includes ten cows, 300 lambs and twenty chickens. He has more than seven years of experience in this field, so the expansion of his farm is very important to him.

Ervand has applied for this loan to purchase two cows and six lambs. This will expand his livestock and will help him to gather more income. This loan is very important for Ervand to cover his family's basic costs and improve his parent's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and six lambs

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg is farmer from Shahumyan village. He lives with his wife and three children. As the only breadwinner of the family, Gevrog works hard to sustain the family and cover its daily costs.

Gevorg keeps 20 chickens, grows apple, apricot and peach trees, and cultivates wheat. He works hard to gather a good harvest and together with his wife, Hasmik, sells it in the local market.

As agriculture is the only source of income for Gevorg and his family, it is very important for him to expand it. He has applied for this loan to pay for renovation of his greenhouse and purchase fertilizer. This will enable him to cultivate more fruits and vegetables and be able to earn a higher income. The loan is very important for Gevorg to ensure a better life for his three children.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of his greenhouse and purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is a 41-year-old mother of four children. She has been involved in agriculture for more than 10 years, and she works hard to sustain her family's life.

Natela runs a farm, which currently includes two cows, 10 mother pigs and 50 little pigs. She also grows peach, apricot and apple trees and cultivates tomatoes. She grows and fattens the pigs and then sells them for higher prices. Agriculture is the only source of income for Natela, and it helps her to cover her family’s basic costs. 

Because she does not having sufficient financial means, Natela needs some support for purchasing forage for the livestock so she applied for this loan. This is very important for her to feed the livestock and continue the expansion of her farm. Natela waits for your support.

loans.use: to purchase forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Mujeres En Progreso Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres en progreso está en su Décimo primer ciclo .Estas 19 señoras están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza,  donde  3 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, pero están con muchas ansias de salir adelante y trabajar para mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Deolinda, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, que es por debajo de la línea de la pobreza. Ella cuenta que para empezar a mejorar su vida puso una despensa, en la que trabaja arduamente, ya que eso le será de muchísima ayuda.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder surtir su despensa con todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad, ya que con eso podrá seguir con su plan de negocios y ayudando también a su familia a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres en Progreso" is in its 11th loan cycle. When these 19 women took the poverty elimination survey, it was found that 3 of the members are below the poverty line, but they have  a strong desire to work to make progress and get ahead.

One of the members is Deolinda, who in the last survey was found to be at poverty level 1, which is below the poverty line.  She says that in order to begin to improve her life she started up a grocery store, where she works arduously, because this business will be a great help to her.  She is requesting a loan to stock up her store with all types of basic consumer goods.  With this investment she will be able to continue with her business plan, and also help improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy basic consumer goods to stock up her store

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
This is Elsa. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more decorative plastic flowers with more designs. The loan also helped with her family's everyday needs. She has been in this business for 15 years, and it continues to grow. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their family.

Elsa would like to apply for another loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos to buy additional stock of decorative plastic flowers and plants. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family’s daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. She hopes that her business will continue to flourish and grow. She dreams of her family having their own house. 

Elso meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business. She draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the word of God that she studies. 

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay back microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of decorative plastic flowers and plants needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma. Dolores

texts.en:
Ma. Dolores is active and a good borrower. She is 46 years old, married with three children. She is grateful and blessed because her eldest child is a scholar of APPEND. She really appreciates the kindness and generosity of the lending institution where she gets her additional capital. Ma. Dolores manages a variety store, sells frozen foods, direct selling and is a rice retailer within her locality.

Ma. Dolores would like to maintain the smooth flow of her income so she could further secure her family's future and send her other two children to a higher level of education and have a better way of living. With her determination to obtain her goals in life, she is seeking another loan amounting to PHP 30,000. She will be using this loan to buy groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks, shampoo, assorted biscuits and instant noodles for her general store. Ma. Dolores expects that her requested loan amount will be approved so she could be a better entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks, shampoo, assorted biscuits and instant noodles for her general store

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Commitment and dedication have been Marissa's guiding principles in managing her variety store.  She is a college graduate who is married with two children.  Both of her children currently go to school.

Marissa aspires to improve her financial stability in order to educate her two children and to sustain and improve their way of life.  Since her business is improving she is in need of additional capital amounting to 30,000 PHP.  She will use this loan to buy items for her store, such as assorted biscuits, cooking oil, ingredients, soft drinks, and canned goods.  She hopes that her business will continue to grow so that she can obtain her goals in life.

loans.use: to buy items for her store, such as assorted biscuits, cooking oil, ingredients, soft drinks, and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish a building

loans.name: Enhtor

texts.en: Mr. Enhtor is 24 years old and lives with his parents in Ger, which is in Tosontsengel soum, Zavhan province, Mongolia.  His parents are herders and move with their livestock.  Mr. Enhtor has been driving a transportation vehicle since 2009.  He is now planning to start his own taxi service business in town and needs 500,000 MNT to purchase spare parts for his existing car.  He is a hardworking and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his existing car in order to provide a taxi service.

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en: Oyuntsetseg is a 43-year-old widow who lives with her son in Ger in Tosontsengel soum of Zavhan province, Mongolia. Her son Erdenechuluun, age 22, studies at the national university in the capital city. Oyuntsetseg graduated with a specialty in interior construction in 2010. She has been working at a local construction company since then and now she is starting her own business in her off-duty time in order to increase her income. She is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase mud mixing equipment to start her own interior renovation business in town. She is a hardworking, open-minded and modest woman.

loans.use: to purchase mud mixing equipment to start her own interior renovation business in town

loans.name: Mbaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Mbaye  est un homme marié qui  habite au  Sénégal. C’est un  enseignant qui  exerce la profession d’instituteur depuis plus de 22 ans. Son salaire combiné aux revenus que lui procure  son moto taxi lui permet de prendre en charge la dépense quotidienne de même  que les paiements de factures du foyer et les frais scolaires de ses enfants. Il est membre à de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où il sollicite un prêt d’un montant de 100.000 francs CFA. L’objet de  son financement est la réparation de son mototaxi qui st tombé en panne. Son intention est de maintenir le niveau de ses revenus de sorte qu’il pourra continuer à supporter ses charges de chef de famille, et de plus améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Son projet  futur est d’investir dans l’enseignement et de créer son propre école privée.
texts.en: Mr. Mbaye is a married man living in Senegal. He has been working professionally as a teacher for over 22 years. His salary, combined with the income that his motorbike taxi brings in, enables him to cover his day-to-day expenses, as well as to pay the house bills and his children's schooling costs. He is a member of a U-IMCEC branch, where he is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 francs CFA. The goal of his financing is to repair his moto-taxi, which broke down. He intends to keep up his income level, so that he will be able to continue supporting his dependents as head of household and to improve further his family's food situation. For the future, his plans are to invest in teaching and to establish his own private school.

loans.use: to repair a motorbike taxi

loans.name: Baasanjav

texts.en:
Mrs. Baasanjav is a 45-year-old widow who lives with her son in Ger, Tosontsengel soum, Zavhan Province, Mongolia.  Her son, Baaska, is a 21-year-old university student.  

Since 2010, Mrs. Baasanjav has been running a Mongolian costume tailoring business at home.  She has built close relationships with her customers and suppliers in town.  She is now requesting a loan of 1,700,000 MNT to pay for her son's tuition and dormitory fees in capital city.  She is a hardworking, helpful, and neat woman.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition and dormitory fees.

loans.name: Alianza Group

texts.es:
El comité Alianza nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar., es un grupo muy trabajador que se fijo como meta el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo Personal.
La Sra. Maria es una mujer emprendedora e innovadora, que se esfuerza siempre por ayudar a sus compañeras y con el ejemplo siempre trata de guiarlas. Ella vende calzados de todas las marcas y tipos, y gracias a la variedad que tiene es que ha podido ganarse una buena clientela, que la ayuda a crecer y a ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de calzados para revenderlos y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo y dando buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Alianza group was created through the management and support of another group working in the same place.  It is a hard-working group that set the goal for growth of each one of their members; not only in finances but also in their personal lives.  

Señora Maria is an enterprising and innovative woman who always tries hard to help her peers and guide them by example.  She sells footwear of all brands and kinds, and thanks to the variety that she offers she has been able to earn a good clientele.  This helps her grow and support her family.

She asks for the loan to purchase footwear to resell, and in this way continue to grow and offer a good variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy footwear to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cloth and local fruits to resell

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
This is Soledad. She previously accessed a loan of 14,000 PHP that she used to buy more newspapers and grocery products. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan of 18,000 PHP to buy newspapers, grocery products, and toiletries needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Soledad dreams of becoming successful in her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy newspapers, grocery products, and toiletries needed in her business.

loans.name: Bienvenido

texts.en:
Bienvinido is 52 years of age and is married with one child. He has been involved in the transportation business particularly motorcycle transport. He has been in this field of business for 7 years and 4 months.

Bienvinido plans to renew his franchise and registration of his motorcycle transport so he is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000. He hopes that his business will continue to grow smoothly. He also hopes to always secure the safety of his passengers so he can obtain better income, which will serve his family's needs and the education of his only child. 

Bienvinido is looking forward to the approval of his requested loan amount.

loans.use: to use in renewal and registration of his motorcycle transport.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación esta en su ciclo numero 15, y gracias al esfuerzo que todas y cada una hace es que están saliendo adelante. Es un grupo muy unido y muestra de ello es la cantidad de ciclos que llevan.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Floriana ella tiene 2 hijos  está acompañada con el Sr. Mario ella se dedica hace varios años a las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa bien surtida y con todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad. Con su negocio está creciendo y ayuda a su familia. Su deseo es que el día de mañana pueda agrandar su negocio y tener mayor capacidad para ofrecer buena variedad a sus clientes.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de productos, como ser bebidas, comestibles, productos a granel y demás. Agradecen por la oportunidad que han recibido, ya que no solo les beneficiara a ellas, sino también a sus familias.
texts.en:
This group, from the city of Encarnación, is asking for its 15th loan from Kiva.  It's thanks to the efforts of each and every one that they are getting ahead.  The group is very united and a sign of this is the number of loan cycles that they have gone through.

One of the members of the group is Floriana.  She has two children and is married to Mario.  She has worked for many years in retail and as a result has a well stocked inventory with every type of basic essential product.  With her business, she is growing and helps her family.  Her wish is that in the future she can expand her business and have more space in order to offer a better variety to her customers.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy goods, such as drinks, food, bulk goods, etc.  They are grateful for the opportunity that they have been given, since it will not only benefit them, but also their families.

loans.use: buy drinks, food, bulk goods, etc.

loans.name: Menardo

texts.en:
This is Menardo, age 52, a resident of the Intramuros district in Manila, Philippines. He is married and a father to his children. He manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his family’s everyday expenses.
Menardo operates a school supplies business. It is where one can buy school supplies, like pens, bond paper, cartolina, and the like, without going to a bookstore. In his store, he also sells cell phone accessories. He gets the supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.
To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. He will be using the loan to buy school supplies and cell phone accessories like batteries, ear phones, chargers, and other accessories to expand his product inventory.
Menardo dreams of expanding his business and hopes that his children will have a better future. He meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and cell phone accessories like batteries, ear phones, chargers, and other accessories to expand his product inventory.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a 44-year-old, married woman, and the mother of six young children. She lives in Ubay, Bohol. She is engaged in a fishing business, together with her husband. They have done this work for several years. This is the source of their income.

Corazon is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat. With the nets and boat repairs, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Corazon hopes to make their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, and to pay for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia. She previously received a 10,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy inventory for her store, in greater variety and larger quantity than before. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in the family's personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help meet her family’s daily needs and cover her children’s education expenses.

Virginia dreams that her business will grow and expand. She hopes that her children will finish their studies. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy items to resell in her store, like groceries, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El en ciclo 17 se encuentra este luchador grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación, gracias a que todas las miembros se han esforzado mucho para llegar al lugar donde están.
La Sra. Angelina, una de las miembros tiene 1 hijo,  está acompañada con el Señor Oscar, quien también es una persona que se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante. Angelina tiene una despensa en su casa, tiene todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, y con su trabajo y ese negocio está creciendo. Su meta es seguir agrandando su negocio para algún día tener una gran tienda.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos de todo tipo para su despensa, como ser verduras, carnes, frutas y demás, ya que gracias a esto podrá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
This determined group from the city of Encarnación is on their 17th Kiva loan, thanks to the great effort of all the members to get where they are now.  Angelina, one of the members, has a son and is married to Oscar, who is also someone who puts forth great effort to get ahead.

Angelina has a pantry in her house with all kinds of basic essential goods and with her work and this business, it is growing.  Her goal is to continue expanding her business so as to one day have her own store.

She is asking for this loan to buy all kinds of consumable, basic essential goods, such as vegetables, meat, fruit, etc.  Thanks to this, she will be able to continue growing.

loans.use: buy vegetables, meat, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en: Bayarmaa is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a ger in Bayanhongor Province in Mongolia. Her husband Purevdorj works with her in their auto repair business. Her son Chintsereg goes to a local secondary school, and her other son, Chinzorig, stays home. Bayarmaa has had her business of auto repair service on their plot of land since 2008. She is now requesting 1,390,000 MNT to purchase spare parts and other necessary items for their business. She and her husband both are hardworking and diligent.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and other necessary items for their business.

loans.name: Jesus Misericordioso Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jesus Misericordioso está en su ciclo 8 del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación, donde cada una de las miembros trabaja duro por salir adelante.
Ester es parte de este grupo, se dedica hace varios años a la venta de milanesas en forma ambulante y sobre pedido desde su casa. Comenta Ester que gracias a la venta que hace tiene un poco de ingresos extras, con lo que ayuda a su familia. Es muy talentosa para la cocina y es por eso que le va muy bien y esta creciendo y mejorando con el tiempo.
Ella está solicitando de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carne, condimentos, harina, huevos y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus milanesas y seguir cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group "Jesús Misericordioso" (Merciful Jesus), is on their 8th loan with the enterprising women program of the foundation, where every one of the members works hard to be successful.  

Ester is a part of this group and has worked for several years selling milanesas (a traditional, breaded cutlet dish) as a street vendor and by taking orders from her house.  Ester says that thanks to the sales that she makes, she has a little extra income that she uses to help her family.  She is very talented at cooking and it is because of this that it is going very well for her.  In addition, she is growing and getting better with time.

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in buying meat, seasonings, flour, eggs, and other consumable goods in order to keep making her milanesas and satisfy her customers.

loans.use: buy meat, seasonings, flour, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia peacefully lives at Alcala. She is married and has a child. To gain income, she rents a stall at the public market, where she sells clothes. She buys them at wholesale prices and resells them for profits. She had been in her business for over 10 years, and she earns about PHP 10,000 monthly.

Delia is planning to improve her sales. That is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000, which she will use to buy more sandals, shirts, blouses, and pants to resell. This will help improve her sales and income.

She hopes to keep offering good products and services, and to keep gaining more profits, as well. This will help her achieve a successful business someday.

loans.use: to buy more sandals, shirts, blouses, and pants to resell at her market stall

loans.name: Lynn

texts.en:
Lynn is a college graduate. She is married and has one child. She has been engaged in a direct selling business for one year and earns about 5,000 PHP per month. She uses her profits for their daily necessities and other obligations. Aside from the direct selling business, she also engaged herself in the vending of street foods as her additional source of income.
Lynn plans to buy silver accessories and stock cosmetic products for her direct selling business, but she struggles due to a shortage of capital. In this regard, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. She hopes to obtain this loan amount to keep her direct selling business more profitable and productive.

loans.use: to buy silver accessories and stock cosmetic products for her direct selling business.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El comité El Progreso se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de  Santaní. El comité pasa al tercer ciclo sin inconvenientes. Todas las integrantes desarrollan actividades diferentes, pero también se ayudan las unas a las otras para salir adelante.
La Sra. Aurelia, una integrante del grupo se dedica a la venta de asaditos (Churrascos) y también vende bebidas, gracias a que tiene buena habilidad para las ventas es que le está yendo tan bien y está saliendo adelante. Se hizo ya de muy buena clientela, que fielmente compra de ella lo que vende.
Aurelia pide este crédito para la compra de  carnes de todo tipo, y también de bebidas, ya que con estos insumos podrá seguir trabajando y teniendo los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The committee El Progreso was formed when some neighbors in the city of Santani came together. They are going into their third cycle without any drawbacks. All of the members have different livelihoods, but they help each other out in order to get ahead.

Aurelia, one of the members, sells grilled meats and also drinks. It's going well for her and she's making progress because she is a good salesperson. She has very good clientele who loyally buy what she sells. Aurelia asks for this loan to buy meats of all kinds and also drinks, since those are the inputs she needs to keep working and continue having a way to support her family.

loans.use: to buy meat and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Ita Yvate Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Ita Ybate  está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de mujeres, las integrantes están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde se puede medir cual es el nivel económico de cada una de ellas y de esa forma poder enfocar la ayuda a las mismas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gladys quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres . A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo que ella hace puede ayudar a su familia, y mantener su negocio.  Ella vende todo tipo de prendas y está contenta, ya que le va muy bien y tiene muy buena clientela.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, como ser camisas, shorts, remeras y demás, ya que con esto podrá tener variedades varias que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group known as "Ita Ybate" is in its 5th cycle with the Women's Committee Program. The members are part of a poverty elimination program, where each one's economic level is measured and the assistance is focused according to the results. 

One of the members is Gladys, who at the last survey was at the level three poverty level. Through her hard work and constant effort she is able to help her family and maintain her business. She sells all types of garments and is content because it's going very well and she has very good clientele.

She asks for this loan to buy a variety of garments like shirts, shorts, t-shirts and other things, since with these she will be able to have various things to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy garments to sell.

loans.name: Dorjhand

texts.en: Mrs. Dorjhand is 30 years old and lives with her mother in a rental apartment in the Amgalan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her mother Dovdii is retired and helps her daughter's business of organic vegetable sales in a rental place. The borrower has been running her organic vegetable sales business in a rental place since 2011. She has gained a lot of experience and regular customers over the years. She is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase organic vegetables and sell to local customers. She is a hardworking, positive and welcoming woman.

loans.use: to purchase organic vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo is 41 years old and married with four kids aged 17, 15, 13 and 10. She lives in Mwambalazi, Kenya. She lives with her family and all of her children are in school. Her main monthly expenditure is the payment of school fees. She earns a living through buying and selling coconuts. She buys from coconut farmers in Mwambalasi and sells to customers in Mombasa, a nearby town. She has been doing this for three months. Her business has grown and she wants to buy coconuts on a large scale. That is why she has requested a loan of KSH 30,000. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy coconuts on a large scale

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn lives with her husband and four children. Two are working abroad; one is married; and one is still studying. She is hard working and always maintains a good attitude while doing her daily routine. Her husband is a driver of a tanker and a mechanic. Gained income from her business goes to their daily commodities and the education of her youngest child.

Marilyn manages a school canteen wherein she offers different kinds of groceries and some native cakes. She has been doing this kind of business for one year. Marilyn would like to purchase more stocks of snack foods, soft drinks, instant cup noodles, candies and glutinous rice for her food stall business. For these reason, she is requesting additional capital of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). She hopes to get this amount of loan so she could improve her sales and profit, which will serve to let her youngest child finish her studies and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase snack foods, soft drinks, instant cup noodles, candies and glutinous rice for her food stall.

loans.name: Andrelita

texts.en:
This is Andrelita. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to buy additional stock of photo supplies and cellphone accessories needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children's education and in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of photo supplies and cellphone accessories needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Andrelita dreams to give her children a good and quality education and hopes to have new businesses for other sources of income. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of photo supplies and cellphone accessories needed in her business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Every human being aspires for a better living. And Anita, aged 55, really seeks a good source of income to achieve a better existence. She wants to offer a standard way of living to her four children in order for them to be motivated in conquering their own lives. In this concern, she is being devoted to her fruits and vegetables business. She wants to boost up a good income from it. And to make that possible, she is requesting financial assistance in the amount of 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy eggplants, potatoes, cabbages, mangoes, ginger, onions and okra.  She believes that through adding additional capital to her business, she will upgrade her usual income.

loans.use: to buy eggplants, potatoes, cabbages, mangoes, ginger, onions and okra.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 54 years old and lives in Galingon, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with five children.

To earn a living, Esterlita has a business selling a variety of foods for snacks. She earns about 1,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. Esterlita has requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

Esterlita has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Esterlita would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

loans.name: Ningome

texts.en:
Ningome is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a goat business in Mwambalazi, Kenya. She has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from farming coconuts. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from Yehu Microfinance. 

She is requesting a loan amounting to 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy little goats and wait for them to grow fat and sell them.

loans.use: to buy little goats.

loans.name: Maria Betty

texts.en:
Maria Betty is married with two children. Maria Betty is 37 years old and lives in La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Maria Betty sells spices to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase more spices to sell.

Maria Betty has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Maria Betty hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more spices to sell.

location.town: Liloy-La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 16 femmes a été crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois et regroupe des femmes issues du même village et des villages environnants unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles. Elle ont eu a bénéficié de plusieurs crédits dans le programme de Banc Villageois.
Le responsable madame Adama est debout à l’extrême droite de la photo la main levée habillée en grand boubou jaune.
Elle est âgée de 48 ans mariée et mère de 10 enfants et 5 autres qui lui sont confiés.
Adama fait du commerce de vente de crèmes glacées depuis longtemps.
Son nouveau crédit de 105.000 francs cfa lui permettra de se procurer du lait en poudre, du sucre et de la vanille pour faire de la crème et la revendre au détail .
Les bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettront de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires, scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group of 16 women was created during the first cycle of the "banc villageois" and groups together women from the same village and surrounding villages, united by strong social and professional bonds. They have already benefited from several loans received from the "banc villageois" program.

The group leader, Adama, is standing on the far right of the photo, dressed in a large yellow bou bou and raising her hand. She is 48 years old, married and the mother of 10 children. She also has 5 more children placed in her care. Adama has been selling ice cream for a long time. Her new loan of 105,000 francs will allow her to buy powdered milk, sugar and vanilla with which to make ice cream for resale to a retail clientèle. The profits generated by her business will enable her to take care of her children's food, education and health needs.

loans.use: to buy powdered milk, sugar and vanilla with which to make ice cream.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has been living with her partner and three children who attend school. They live in the village.

Rose tells us that she used to work as a shop attendant, and after one year of effort, she was able to open her business from home.

Now she has had a fast-food counter for about one year. She is applying for the loan to buy products for her business, such as baked goods, beverages, seasonings, etc. She is grateful for the help that she is receiving, since it will be very useful to her.

loans.use: to buy products for her business, such as baked goods, beverages and seasonings.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia offer street foods within her local community. She has been doing this for two years and three months. Aside from this business, she also runs a livestock and farming business.

Cresencia plans to increase the products she offers in order to improve her income. To attain her goal, she is seeking financial assistance amounting to PHP 10,000. She knows that this loan will help her in improving the taste of her bar-b-que chickens head and sauce. She hopes that through improving the taste of the street foods she offers, she could further satisfy her customer demand. Cresencia is expecting continuous improvement of her food vending, livestock and farming business. In this way, she will be able to give her family a more comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy raw meat, hot dogs and chicken for her food vending business.

loans.name: Uchi

texts.en: Uchi is a 33-year-old hardworking lady. She is married with three children. She lives in Mwabalazi, Kenya, where she keeps poultry and sells eggs. She has been doing this for four years, and her customer range has increased. She has approached Yehu for a loan request amounting to 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy poultry and poultry feeds. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy poultry and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy beauty items for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en: Crispina is a 69-year-old married woman and a mother of six grown-up children from Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in a food vending business selling home-cooked snack foods. This is the source of her income. Crispina is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients like bananas, flour, sugar and cooking oil. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more snack foods thus augmenting her income and profit. Crispina dreams of expanding her business. She saves money to reinvest in the business and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients such as bananas, flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Chhabi

texts.en:
Chhabi, a differently-able person aged 28, is married and lives with his parents, wife and a child. He resides in Odisha, India. Chhabi has been operating a variety store at the village market to earn a living and support his family. He sells detergents, chocolates, noodles, pickles, spices, biscuits, cosmetics and other daily used necessities in his shop. He earns 6,000 INR.

The part that he likes most about his job is the interaction with the different customers.
