He requested a loan of 30,000 INR to purchase additional products like stationery, wafers, hair oil and shampoo to meet the needs of the customers. In the future, Chhabi wants to enhance his business and see that his child completes his education. He wants to give his family a better life than what he has now.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing detergents, chocolates, noodles, pickles, spices, biscuits, cosmetics, etc for his variety store.

loans.name: Mouna

texts.en:
Mouna is a 49-year-old, married Palestinian woman, mother of six children, for whom she sacrifices her life to help her husband in replying to their needs.

In 2001, Mouna opened a book and stationery shop. She sells all types of school stationery, like pens, pencils, papers; she also has a printer, newspapers, books, and much more. She notes that when she first started, she faced some challenges in securing sufficient financing for her business. She decided on doing her business because she wanted to improve her family's financial situation and she thought that it was needed in her region.     

Today, Mouna has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. She plans to pay for her son's university fees in Cyprus. She is so happy that she is capable of providing her children with the best education ever. She hopes they will have a brighter future since their lives in Lebanon have no chance to expand because all the Palestinian refugees have limited access to some businesses.

This will be Mouna's third cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. She has a good-standing history of paying back loans. Her previous loans helped a lot in expanding her business and improving her family's social living. She hopes to further expand and enhance her business in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university fees.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Adama est un père de famille.Il pratique l'agriculture depuis plusieurs années.Il cultive du mile et de l'arachide en saison des pluies, ce qui lui permet de disposer de produits alimentaires pour sa famille.En saison sèche, il pratique l'embouche bovine afin de générer des ressources financières pour prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de son épouse, de ses quatre enfants ainsi que leurs frais de santé et de scolarité.Afin de réaliser une nouvelle opération d'embouche, il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter deux bœufs.Son ambition est de faire des voyages de commerce à l'intérieur du pays.
texts.en:
Adama is a father. He has been practicing agriculture for several years now.

He cultivates millet and peanuts during the rainy season, which provides food for his family. During the dry season, he fattens up steers in order to generate financial resources to support his wife and four children and to cover their schooling fees.

In order to continue his steer-fattening operations, he is seeking a loan of 400,000 f to buy two steers. His goal is to start making trips within the country for trade purposes.

loans.use: to buy two steers

loans.name: Imran

texts.en:
Imran has been running a cosmetic store in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This store is the only source of income for the family. He is a very hard-working person and tries his best to fulfill the needs of his family. His wife is a responsible housewife. 

Presently, Imran is interested in growing his business by purchasing a variety of cosmetic products, like shampoos, soaps, perfumes, powders, nail polishes, lipsticks, and lip gloss. 

Therefore, he has requested a loan in the amount of PKR 100,000 from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will help Imran to satisfy the demands of his clients more professionally. He is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for his business and his family's future.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cosmetic products  to sell.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 25-year-old man living in Sana'a. Mohammed completed only secondary school and could not go ahead with his studies due to the difficult living conditions he faced. Mohammed's business is a grocery store that he started with limited capital. Mohammed was able to attract new clients. This has had an impact on increasing his business capital and income. He was happy for the increase in clients but on the other hand, he faced a financial challenge because he was not able to meet the demands of his clientele. He requested a loan of 500,000 YER from Al-Amal Bank in order to meet the demands of his clients by providing the needed grocery goods. It is worth mentioning that Mohammed is one of the trusted clients of AMB. In the future, he hopes to expand his business by opening a wholesale store. He also hopes to get married.

loans.use: to meet the demands of his clients by stocking the requested grocery items.

loans.name: Mehwish's Group

texts.en:
Mehwish is a 22-year-old woman who lives in Pakistan with her husband. Her husband is a tailor whose income is too low to cover their household expenses. Since 2011 Mehwish herself has been running a beauty salon. 

As a member of 7-person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase cosmetic products like lipstick, facial creams, etc., for the salon. With the profits she wants to renovate her house and repay the loan amount. 

She wants to thank all the BRAC staff for being so co-operative. 

Note: In the picture there are 6 members instead of 7. As Balqees is not feeling comfortable to give her picture on the Kiva website, due to some personal issues.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products like lipstick, facial creams, etc for the salon.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en: Mbodze is a hardworking 53 year old lady. She is married and has four children. She lives with her family, children and husband in Mwambalazi, Kenya. She owns a cereal vending business where she sells cereals including maize and peas. She has requested a loan of ksh. 40,000 to buy ten sacks of maize.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of maize.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
This is Jovelyn. She previously accessed an 18,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 22,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jovelyn dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes for a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 42 years old, married to Ruben and has four children. She raises hogs as a source of income, because she did not finish her education due to early marriage, while her husband works as laborer in a farm supply enterprise. They are helping each other to meet the needs of their four children, most importantly their educational needs. Their eldest has chosen to leave school so that his younger siblings can have some education. Now, he is also helping his parents by working as a gasoline boy. Presently, Marilyn is making her business better and she is in need of more capital. She is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy feed, vitamins and three more hogs. She is hoping that her requested loan will be approved in order to earn a higher income for her children.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and three more hogs.

loans.name: Jyambere Munyarwandakazi/rgrr Group

texts.fr:
Jacqueline fait partie du groupe solidaire JYAMBERE MUNYARWANDAKAZI/RGRR qui fait l’agriculture des maïs. Elle est mariée, âgée de 39 ans et a 7 enfants dont le plus âgé a 22 ans et le moins âgé a 10 ans. Quatre de ses enfants vont à l’école et aucune autre personne n’est en sa charge.
Elle n’est au Rwanda et n’a aucun niveau d’éducation.
Elle a commencé de collaborer avec ACB Ltd en 2011 et  est au premier cycle de crédit.
Avec le crédit demandé, elle va louer un champ, payer la main d’œuvre et acheter la semence.
La seule difficulté  qui peut faire que ce prêt soit mal remboursé qu'anticipe Madama Jacqueline est la mauvaise récolte.
Pour accroitre son activité, elle a la stratégie d’utiliser les engrais chimiques. L’ambition pour son activité agricole est d’avoir son propre champ. Pour sa famille, elle a l’ambition d’éduquer ses enfants et assurer le bien être de sa famille.
A part de l’agriculture elle fait aussi le commerce de divers objets en détailles.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a member of the solidarity group JYAMBERE MUNYARWANDAKAZI/RGRR who farms corn. She's 39 years old, married, and has seven children. The eldest is 22, and the youngest is ten. Four of her children attend school, and she doesn't have any additional person in her care.

Jacqueline was born in Rwanda, and never attended school. She started her collaboration with Kiva's partner, ACB Ltd, in 2011 and she's seeking her first loan, which she will use to rent a field, pay for labor, and buy seeds.

Mrs. Jacqueline only anticipates one difficulty that could impact the reimbursement of her loan : a poor harvest. Her strategy to grow her business is to use chemical fertilizers. Her ambition for her farming business is to own her own field.

Concerning her family, she ambitions to educate her children and ensure the well-being of her family. In addition to farming, she also retails various items.

loans.use: to rent a field, pay for labor, and buy seeds.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en: Nimfa is 48-years-old and married with three adult children. She and her family all live in Bitaug, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor. She fishes in the ocean to earn a living. She has requested a loan to purchase a one unit engine for her fishing boat.

loans.use: to purchase a one unit engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda manages a hog raising, farming, direct-selling business and grows vegetables to sell in her backyard.  She has managed her farming and hog raising business since 2006 while her direct-selling business has been underway for five years. Imelda would like to her business to succeed and become a well respected business in her town so she's doing all her best in order to fulfill her dreams in life.

Imelda is married and blessed with three children. Two of her children are still studying while the other helps on the farm. Since her direct selling is going well, she is in need of additional capital to supply and satisfy the costumer demand. For this reason, she is seeking a loan for PHP 40,000. This amount will be used to buy herbal products such as juice, coffee, regrowth shampoo and foot powder for her retail business. She hopes and prays for approval of her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to buy herbal juice, coffee, shampoo and foot powder for her retail business

loans.name: Aleksandre

texts.en:
Aleksandre is 50-years-old. He lives with his wife, three children, daughter-in-law, grandchild and retired mother. The family are farmers. In particular, they run a dairy farm with 6 calves and 6 milk cows, whose milk is used for dairy products. They produce yogurt and cheese and sell them in village stores and in the capital city. In addition, Aleksandre owns 112 sheep and sells lambs twice a year; in spring and in fall.
Aleksandre is a very hard-working man, with a lot of experience. 
He has requested a loan to purchase feed for his cattle. With the credit, Aleksandre will buy hay and after the cattle are fed properly, they will produce lots of milk. The family will then be able to produce more dairy products and sell them for a good price. This will significantly increase the family income and all members of the family will improve their living conditions. Aleksandre awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase feed for cattle

loans.name: Ndiankou

texts.fr: Monsieur Ndiankou  est un habitant du Sénégal. Il est marié et vit avec sa famille. Il s’active dans le secteur de la pêche depuis plus de 22 ans. Il est plongeur et cette activité a travers les revenus qu’elle lui procure  lui  permet de subvenir a ses besoins et charges familiales. Il est marié et gère la dépense quotidienne de son foyer ainsi que le paiement des factures.Il débute sa journée de travail a 7 heures du matin pour la terminer a 17 heures.    Il est membre du guichet de l’UIMCEC de la localité ou il vit. Il sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs prévu pour les frais d’entretien de sa pirogue. Ce financement lui permettra de maintenir le niveau de ses gains financier et de continuer a faire fac e a ses charges de père de famille. Son rêve dans le futur est de disposer de plus de pirogues et de machines de pêche dans le sens de développer son activité de pêche.
texts.en: Ndiankou is an inhabitant of Senegal. He is married and lives with his family. He has been working in the fishing industry for over 22 years. He is a diver and the revenues he gets from this business allow him to take care of his needs and the family expenses. He is married and manages his household's daily expenditures as well as paying the bills. He starts his workday at 7 o'clock in the morning and finishes it at 5 o'clock in the afternoon. He is a member of his local UIMCEC branch and is requesting a loan of 400 000 francs to be used to pay the maintenance costs of his canoe. This loan will enable him to maintain his current profit level and continue to meet his responsibilities as a father. His dream would be to develop his fishing business and one day own more canoes and fishing machinery.

loans.use: to pay the maintenance fees for his canoe.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is a widow with 4 children. She is 59-years-old and lives in Camul, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.
Luz owns a store to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP. She has requested a loan to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and other consumable products.
Luz has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Luz hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and other consumable products

loans.name: Hirwa Mutegarugori A/rgrr Group

texts.fr:
Donathile fait partie du groupe solidaire HIRWA MUTEGARUGORI A/RGRR qui fait l’agriculture des maïs. Elle est mariée, âgée de 48 ans et a 5 enfants dont le plus âgé a 20 ans et le moins âgé a 13 ans. Trois de ses enfants vont à l’école et aucune autre personne n’est en sa charge.
Elle n’est en République Démocratique du Congo, son niveau d’éducation est 2 ans de l’école primaire.  
Elle a commencé de collaborer avec ACB Ltd en 2012 et  est au premier cycle de crédit.
Avec le crédit demandé, elle va louer un champ, payer la main d’œuvre et acheter la semence.
Madame Donathile anticipe une  seule difficulté qui peut faire que ce prêt soit mal remboursé. Cette difficulté  est le changement climatique.
Pour accroitre son activité, elle a la stratégie d’utiliser les engrais chimiques. L’ambition pour son activité agricole est d’avoir son propre champ. Pour sa famille, elle a l’ambition d’éduquer ses enfants jusqu’à l’université et assurer le bien être de sa famille.
A part de l’agriculture elle fait aussi le commerce de divers objets en détailles.
texts.en: Donathile is part of the "Hirwa Mutegarugori A/rgrr" solidarity group which grows corn. She is 48 years old, married and the mother of 5 children, the eldest of whom is 20 years old and the youngest, 13. Three of her children go to school and she is not responsible for any other people. She was born in the Democratic Republic of Congo and has 2 years of primary school education. She started working together with ACB in 2012 and is on her first loan cycle. She will use the loan requested to rent a field, pay the labourers and buy seeds. Donathile anticipates only one problem which could prevent repayment of the loan; climate change. In order to increase her business, her strategy is to use chemical fertilizers. As far as her farming business is concerned, her ambition is to have her own field. Her ambition for her family is to make sure her children are educated at university level and to ensure her family's well-being. As well as farming, she also sells various items to retail customers.

loans.use: to rent a field, buy seeds and pay the labourers.

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en: Mrs. Tuya, 38-years-old, lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband has been offering transportation services between Ulaanbaatar and Baganuur, one of the nine districts of the capital city but considered a separate city. She herself has been working as a barkeeper for five years and has accumulated vast amounts of customer service experience. The automobile her husband uses for his transportation business runs on natural gas. She and her husband have been paying off this automobile since May 2012 and now have only 2,500,000 MNT remaining. She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to pay the remaining payment for the automobile. As a result, the car will be theirs which will be used for transportation services and more importantly, natural gas powered cars have benefits of emitting less smoke, thus, contributing to the efforts against air pollution. As a person who cares and worries about the environment, Tuya has encouraged her husband to use a natural gas powered automobile for his business.

loans.use: to pay the remaining amount of her family's natural gas car

loans.name: Darejan

texts.en: Darejan is 66-years-old and is from a small village near the Capital city of Georgia. She is married and with 2 sons and 2 daughter-in-laws.  The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 6 milk cows and 5 calves. She milks cows and produces yogurt and cheese, which is sold locally as well as in the capital city. Darejan is a very hard working woman and has a lot of experience in her business. She requests a loan to purchase feed for her cattle. After purchasing the feed, the cattle will fatten properly allowing Darejan to produce more dairy products. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her cattle

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en: Rosalyn is 34-years-old, married and has three children. They are currently residing in the village of Manaoag.  She has owned and operated a retail store in her village for almost 5 years and earns a net income of  14,000 PHP. She requests a loan of to 10,000 PHP to purchase rice, canned goods, biscuits, noodles, and beverages for resale. She's hoping that her loan request will be granted so that she can improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase rice, canned goods, biscuits, noodles, and beverages for resale

loans.name: Mamadou Diène

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou Diène  habite au Sénégal. Il est célibataire et  évolue depuis plus de 5 ans dans le secteur du commerce. Il exerce l’achat et la vente de matériels informatiques.  Les revenus que lui procure son activité de commerce lui permettent de participer à la gestion de la dépense quotidienne au sein de sa famille. Il est membre  de  l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où il a déjà remboursé 6 prêts  antérieurs.  Présentement, il sollicite un crédit d’un montant de 250.000 francs CFA prévu pour l’achat de matériels informatiques destinés a la vente . Son intention est de développer de développer son  activité de commerce et accroitre ses bénéfices pour mieux supporter ses charges personnels et familiales (contribution dans l’amélioration des conditions alimentaires de la  famille).  Son projet dans le futur consiste à   disposer  d’un magasin spécialisé dans vente de matériel informatique.
texts.en: Mamadou Diène lives in Senegal. He is single and has been a retailer for over 5 years. He buys and sells computing equipment. The revenue generated by his business allows him to contribute toward the management of his family's daily expenses. He is a member of a UIMCEC branch and has already repaid 6 previous loans. He is currently requesting a loan of 250 000 francs which is to be used to buy computer equipment for resale. His aim is to develop his business and increase his profits so that he can better cover his personal and family expenses (i.e. contributing to an improvement in his family's nutrition). His future ambition is to own a shop specialising in the sale of computer equipment.

loans.use: to buy computing equipment for resale.

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en:
Tobias is a 29-year-old, hardworking gentleman, married to Atieno and a father of one child. He is a tailor and has been in the business for the last three years earning a monthly income of KES. 20,000.

He learnt about KADET LTD through a roadshow organized in his area. He has requested his first loan of KES.10000 to purchase of a variety of fabrics for dressmaking.
He plans to use his anticipated proceeds to provide the family's basic needs. He hopes to attain financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for dressmaking.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 39-year-old lady, married, with two sons. She sells seasonal fruits and vegetables, such as mangoes, pears, oranges, apples, pomegranates, bananas, onions, potatoes, and cabbages. She has 2 years of experience in this has gained the necessary skills and knowledge required for this business.

She wants to expand her business and buy sacks of mangoes and oranges. She has requested a loan of KES 36,034.

loans.use: to buy sacks of mangoes and oranges.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann sells fruits, but she also has a small snack bar that she established more than 5 years ago. She started out with a small amount of capital she obtained from her previous business. Ann set up a wooden stand on one of the busiest and most well-known street corners. She was able to form a large customer base. Ann is a self-sacrificing person who has demonstrated that she can get ahead as a result of her work. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy sodas, snacks, cookies and other items to restock her snack bar, which will allow her to continue working.

loans.use: to buy sodas, snacks, cookies to supply her snack bar.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
This is Eugenia, 76, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is a widow and mother to her eight children who now have their own families. She, with the help of her children, manages her business. She is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Eugenia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Eugenia still dreams of seeing her business grow and hopes that her grandchildren will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her variety store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy repairing tools, wires etc for UPS repairing services

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther is a 29-year-old dryland farmer and mother of four. Her agricultural business of growing maize and peas faces the challenges of water shortages and poor transportation networks in the rural areas. 

In addition to farming, Esther is also a tailor. She intends to use the profits from her tree farm to buy a tailoring machine and start a workshop. From this business and in addition to the profits from the trees, Esther will be able to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm inputs such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical training and maintenance support

loans.name: Jargal

texts.en: Mrs. Jargal is 41 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in a house in the Orhon province of Mongolia. Her husband Lhagvasuren, age 47, has worked at a local security service company for years now. Her daughter Shinedaram, age 20, studies at university and son Tuvshinbayar, age 18, goes to a specialty training school. Jargal has been running a traditional noodle making business with her partner since 2009. She has gained a lot of experience and regular customers over the years. She is now requesting 3,000,000 MNT to pay her daughter's outstanding tuition fee and purchase a mixing machine for her business. She is a hardworking and diligent woman.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's outstanding tuition fee and purchase a mixing machine noodle making business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is an industrious man married to Joyce, a farmer. He is a father of eight children between 26 and 6 years of age. He operates a taxi business as well as running a general store. He heard about KADET LTD from a credit officer who is a regular customer in his busy shop.

He has requested a first loan of KES. 20,000 to buy a variety of consumable products e.g. maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat for sale.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his school going children as well as build a better house for his family. His dream is to own a chain of grocery markets.

loans.use: to purchase consumable products for his general store.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a hardworking man. He is 52 years old, and married with four children. He lives in Mwambalasi, Kenya together with his family. He is a carpenter by profession and he owns a hardware yard where he sells lumber and makes furniture to sell to customers who either buy it readymade or by custom order. In the last few months he has received a large order and has ran short of timber.  He has now approached for loan in the amount of KES 50,000 to buy lumber for the yard.

loans.use: to buy lumber to produce furniture and sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is single. Marilou is 36 years old and lives in Galingon, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.
Marilou owns a sari-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for 14 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and other consumable products.
Marilou has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Marilou hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and other consumable products.

loans.name: Noraida

texts.en:
Noraida is married with 4 children. Noraida is 45 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.
Noraida sells cloth to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 7000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase more meters of cloth to sell.
Noraida is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Noraida hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more meters of cloth to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is married with one child. Patricia is 50 years old and lives in Clarin, Mis. Occ, Philippines.
Patricia sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, milk, Milo, etc..
Patricia has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Patricia hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional product such as canned goods, milk, Milo, etc to stock her variety store.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en:
Valeriana is 51 years old and married with five children, who are adults, and lives in Candanay Norte, Siquijor.

She has raised pigs for five years and earns PHP 5000 a month to help cover their costs of living.

She has been a PMPC member for two years and now she has requested a loan of PHP 4000 to be used to purchase additional pigs for to raise.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs for to raise.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of three young children ages 9, 8 and 5. They live in Ubay, Bohol. Her husband works as a carpenter. Delia has earned a living through her sari-sari/variety store for more than four years now.
Delia needs a loan for the expansion of her business. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, bread, chips, soda, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to cater and sell more goods to the people in her area. In the future, Delia hopes to make her business a success and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, bread, chips, soda, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Eter

texts.en:
Eter is 51 years old and lives in the village of Sartichala with her husband and two children (14 and 15 years old). The children go to the local school. The only source of income for the family is their small poultry farm with 15 hens. They sell eggs in the village. Now Eter is raising a piglet and plans to sell it after several months. According to governments estimations the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category and they get a small social assistance each month. Her younger son has chronic health problems and gets a relevant pension from the local government.
Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program has provisions of business start-up and restartup credits with soft conditions to the country’s rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to low income.
With the received credit Eter will start up a trading business. She will purchase bed-clothing and detergents in Turkey at wholesale prices and sell them among the villagers at a retail price. Part of the profits will be reinvested in the same business and the rest will be used for daily expanses.
Eter will be able to improve the quality of life for her family members. She awaits your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase bed-clothing and detergents to sell in her village.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty said that she benefited from the previous loans as follows; she increased her working capital, she bought many clothes, she paid part of her children school fees.  She is now taking a new loan to buy more stock and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and other items.

loans.name: Sabala Shg Group

texts.en:
Austin is pictured on the right with his hand raised amongst his Sabala SHG Group members. The 24 of them, 18 women and 6 men, are farmers in Kakamega South District. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. Austin first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2009 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Austin joined One Acre Fund in order to use increased profits to send his children to school and gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Austin was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize per 1 acre, but after planting with the One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, he was able to harvest 17 bags per 1 acre! He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and save for the future. Austin’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 12 acres of maize and sorghum.

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 57-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband, five daughters and two sons in Punjab, Pakistan. Her husband is a hawker and her elder son is working as a laborer. Since 2007, Nasreen has been running a general store. She works very hard to meet her family's needs. She needs additional capital for the growth of her business. 

Nasreen is a member of 5-person lending group, and she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan money, she will buy a variety of goods like sugar, water bottles, soft drinks, etc. for the general store. This will help her satisfy her clients more professionally as well as to increase her savings for a better future for her children.

Nasreen is very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for the family.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of goods like sugar, water bottles, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jembe Group

texts.en:
Roselyne is pictured on the right with her hand raised amongst her Jembe Group members. The 11 of them, 10 women and 1 man, are farmers in Kakamega South District. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. Roselyne first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2007 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Roselyne joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and other improvements like Solar Lights also offered by One Acre Fund.

Roselyne described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and pay future One Acre Fund loans. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Roselyne’s group will receive 5 1/2 acres worth of inputs on credit.

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyne is 22 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Evelyne has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Evelyne has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal to sell, and will help Evelyne to generate greater profits. She will use the profits to pay school fees for her child. Evelyne hopes that in the future she will be able to become a powerful business woman. 

Evelyne is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina is married with 2 children. She is 37 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. Divina owns a store to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years. Each month, she earns about 3,500 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store such as toothpastes, shampoos, soaps and others. She has been a member of PMPC since 2012. In the future, Divina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as toothpastes, shampoos, soaps and others.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 30 years old and is from a small village in the Gardabani district. She is married and has a large family: her husband, three children and her parents-in-law. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have milk cows. Nino milks cows and produces yogurt and cheese which is sold locally. 

She is a very hardworking woman and has a rich experience in her business. She requested a loan to expand the shed for the cattle. After the shed is expanded Nino will be able to increase the number of livestock and produce more dairy products. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to expand the shed for the cattle.

loans.name: John Sebit

texts.en:
John is a 30 yrs old business man who live in Yei. He is married with 3 children between the age 4 and 10. All of them go to school. John runs a general store, and has been in business for 6 years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is requesting a loan of 4000ssp to purchase more soda, soap, tea leaves, and many other items. Other than this business, he has no other source of Income.

In 5 years John would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation cost.
John says he is happy for the loans given by finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: for buying more items like soda, water, tea leaves, soap, etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy rice, snacks and cooking oil for a general store business

loans.name: Bancy

texts.en:
Bancy is a 34 years old business lady. She is a single mother of a ten year old child. She has been selling green vegetables, Irish potatoes, tomatoes, green maize, fruit, etc. with a monthly income of KES. 40,000 which she uses to support her child. 

Bancy is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD after being introduced to KADET by a staff member. She will use the loan to buy green vegetables, Irish potatoes, tomatoes, green maize, and fruit for sale. With the expected earnings from the business she plans to pay for her child’s school fees and open a cereal store. 

She hopes to be able to give her child the best education, open a big cereal store and supply institutions with food.

loans.use: to buy green vegetables, Irish potatoes, tomatoes, green maize, and fruits.

loans.name: Matokwani

texts.en:
Matokwani is taking out a second loan to open another mobile money transfer shop in a small border town called Katima. Katima is located 10km away from his hometown of Sesheke. The loan will help him to pay for rentals, hire new staff and have working capital. Matokwani is very excited to be taking out his second loan, and he is quick to say that his business improved greatly when he received his first loan. This is because he was able to serve more customers who wanted to send and receive money from his shop. 

When asked how the first loan impacted his family life, he says that because he was able to serve more customers, he made more profits so he was able to help his niece with her school fees without feeling too much pressure.

Matokwani sees this as one more step toward realizing his dream of running a big business that makes life easy for his customers by delivering services efficiently without having to keep them waiting. He thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To open a second mobile money transfer shop in the nearby border town of Katima.

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en: Celerina is 48 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 4 children. Celerina works in the fish industry and she catches and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional net for fishing. She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Celerina hopes to expand her fishing business.

loans.use: to purchase additional net for fishing.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар жительница города Истаравшан. Ей 56 лет. Она замужем и у нее один взрослый сын. Дилбар добрая и трудолюбивая женщина. Она работает продавщицей на рынке и продает сезонную одежду. Дилбар занимается торговлей более 10 лет. Она берет кредит на сумму 3000 долларов для закупа товара на продажу. За счет прибыли с продажи Дилбар хочет расширить свой бизнес и увеличить семейный бюджет.
texts.en:
Dilbar is a 65-year-old resident of Istaravshan. She is married and has one adult son. 

Dilbar is a kind, hard-working woman. She sells seasonal clothing at the local market. She has been working in sales for over ten years. She is requesting this 3000 dollar loan to purchase goods for subsequent salel. She wants to use the extra income to expand her business and increase her family budget.

loans.use: to purchase goods for subsequent sale

loans.name: Salim

texts.ru: Салиму 55 лет. Он с женой и тремя детьми проживает в городе Истаравшан. Салим честный и трудолюбивый человек. Он занимается животноводством уже 8 лет. Салим покупает крупно-рогатый скот и после откорма перепродает его с наценкой. В его деятельности помогают сыновья. Салим запрашивает кредит на сумму 2500 долларов для закупа коров и телят. За счет прибыли с их продажи он хочет расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Fifty-five-year-old Salim and his wife live together with their three children in the city of Istaravshan. Salim is an honest, hard-working person. He has been working in animal husbandry for eight years now. He purchases cattle and after feeding them, he resells them at a higher price. His sons help him with this business. Salim is requesting this 2500 dollar loan to purchase some cows and calves. He wants to use the additional income to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 58 years old and lives in Pulot, Ozamiz City, in the Philippines. She is married with two adult children and has been operating a general store for almost six years. She earns approximately 2000 Philippines pesos (PHP) every month and has requested a loan  to buy stocks for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and other consumable products.

Nelia has been a member of PMPC for almost five years. She hopes to expand her business into a neighboring town after three years.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and other consumable products

loans.name: Sada's Group

texts.en:
Sada is a forty-two-year-old mother of eleven children. She and her husband are both dryland farmers. None of Sada's children are currently attending school, but she hopes with the proceeds from her KOMAZA tree farm she will be able to provide an education for her children. 

Sada shares, "I liked KOMAZA because it is out to eradicate poverty in our villages." Also pictured with the group of four are Kahindi and Daniel, both dryland farmers who are interested in the KOMAZA microforestry program but unable to join this planting season.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm inputs such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical trainings and maintenance support.

loans.name: Ingusi Group

texts.en:
Ingusi Group is located in Kakamega South District. It is a group of 13 women and 3 men led by Mabel, pictured on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.  Mabel joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011 seaspm, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season.  Mabel joined One Acre Fund so that she could access the best input prices and pay for the loan slowly.

Mabel described her harvest as excellent last year as a One Acre Fund farmer and hopes for another good year in the 2013 Long Rains season. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and save for the future.  For the 2013 Long Rains season, Mabel’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each.  In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 8 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Amani Group

texts.en:
Amani is a group of ten farmers in Kakamega South District. The group consists of nine women and one man.  Everline is the group representative. 

Everline is the woman with her hand raised in the photograph. She will receive farming inputs on credit, which will consist of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. Everline joined One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains, and is now enrolling in the 2013 Long Rains season. Everline joined One Acre Fund to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and because of the convenient input delivery time. 

Everline described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and buy a cow. 

For the 2013 Long Rains season, Everline’s group members will each take input loans for ½ an acre. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on five acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is a farmer in the remote village of Isingiro who is married with 6 children, and all in school.  He started farming at the early age of 10 after losing both his parents at a tender age.  Because of such circumstances, he struggled much to survive through farming.  He managed to put up his own banana plantation which has allwed him to even start constructing a semi-permanent house to accommodate him and his family members. 

He is requesting a loan for 2,200,000 shillings to enclose his house and complete it.  He will be using proceeds from the plantain plantation to service the requested loan.  In the photograph is Johnson with his wife in front of their incomplete residential house.

loans.use: To buy shutters for his house

loans.name: Pedra

texts.en:
Pedra 40 years old and lives in Guba, Clarin. Misamis Occidental .Philippines.  She is married with 2 school-aged children.

Pedra operates a transportation business and her husband is the one who helps her in this activity.  She has been doing this for almost 5 years.  In this kind of business Pedra supports her family's needs.  She has requested a loan of 50,000  PHP to purchase materials for her jeep repair.
Pedra has been a member of PMPC for almost 4 years.  She hopes to to make her business successful.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her jeep repair

loans.name: Murad

texts.en: Murad, is a 21-year-old single man.  He has three brothers and one sister.  Murad works as a barber after school where he goes to study Mechanical Designs, and he is now in his second year.  Murad is now applying for this educational loan to pay for the upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for the upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Twende Kazi Group

texts.en:
Twende Kazi Group is located in Kakamega South District.  It is a group of 11 women and 4 men led by Nicodemus pictured on the right with his hand raised.  He is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.  Nicodemus joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2009 season, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season.  Nicodemus joined One Acre Fund so that he could access the best input prices and to improve his farming techniques with One Acre Fund methods.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Nicodemus was only able to harvest 25 bags of maize per acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012 season, he was able to harvest 35 bags per acre!  He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and repair his home.  During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit.  Nicodemus’s group will receive 7 1/2 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Ma. Lalaine

texts.en:
Lalaine is 40 years old and lives in Brgy. BAngkal, Ozamiz City.  She is married with 3 adult- aged, 3 school-aged and 1 infant child.

Lalaine engaged in general store business and she has been doing this for almost 2 years.  She earns approximately 3,000 PHP every month.  She has requested a loan  to purchased items like canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar for her general store business. This business helps her a lot to improve her living condition.

Shes been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years.  She hopes to expand her business after 5 years.

loans.use: to purchased items like canned goods, noodles,coffee,sugar  for her general store business

loans.name: Pioneer Group

texts.en:
Bernard is pictured on the right with his hand raised amongst his Pioneer Group members.  The 10 of them, 7 women and 3 men, are farmers in Kakamega South District. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. Bernard joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011 season, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season.  Bernard joined One Acre Fund so that he could access the best input prices and gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Bernard described his harvest as  good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year.  He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and to buy a cow.  Bernard’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season.  In total they will receive inputs for 5 acres of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Wakulima Mayiakalo Group

texts.en:
Janeveva is a member of Wakulima Mayiakalo Group in Kakamega South District. She is pictured with 13 One Acre Fund farmers, eight women and five men. Janeveva is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for a half acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. 

Janeveva joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2010 and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Janeveva joined One Acre Fund so that she could use increased profits to send her children to school and gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Janeveva was only able to harvest seven bags of maize per acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 20 bags per acre! 

She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and save for the future. Jeneveva’s group members will each receive input loans of a half acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 6 1/2 acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Donato	Jr.

texts.en:
Donato Jr. is a fisherman from Ubay, Bohol, Philippines. He is married and has six children. 

Donato is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and buckets. The loan will help him to improve his catch therefore allow him to sell more fish in the market. In the future, Donato Jr. hope to expand his fishing business and save money for his children's educational needs and to repay his loan.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and buckets.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine, 35, is married to a farmer. They were blessed with three children. Geraldine and her family live in Pulay village. 

Geraldine has owned and operated a retail store for almost five years. She is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan to purchase canned goods, noodles, biscuits, curls, and beverages. She hopes that her request for a loan will be granted so that her business can become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, biscuits, curls, and beverages.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Eva is 21 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is single and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Eva has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, milk, bread and juice . 

To help expand her business, Eva has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to stock a larger variety of different items such as cooking oil and maize flour for the store, and will help Eva to generate greater profits and take care of her family.  Eva hopes that in the future she will be able to have a better life. 

Eva is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock a larger variety of different items such as cooking oil and maize flour for the store,

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is  48 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.  She is married with 2 children.

Rebecca works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living.  She has been doing this for 20 years.  She has requested a loan to purchase more fish to sell.  Rebecca has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Rebecca hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 38 years old.  She is married and has 2 children.

Elizabeth is known for being a hardworking person with many entrepreneurial ideas.  She has a grocery store which helps her generate income to support her family.

She is applying for the loan to buy more basic products to stock her store in order to satisfy the demands of the community, and with this she will also increase her income.

loans.use: to buy products such as milk, sugar and baked goods for her store

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou, 56, is married and has one child. She lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.

Marilou owns a sari-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP doing this work. 

She has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase toothpastes, soaps, shampoos and other items for her general store business.

Marilou has been a member of PMPC year 2012. In the future, Marilou hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase toothpastes, soaps, shampoos and other items for her general store business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 58 years old and lives in the Ozurgeti district with his wife. The family runs an agricultural business and cultivates family-owned land, growing nuts and maize. The harvested products are sold at the local open market. 

David requested a loan for starting up a trading business. His loan requests were rejected each time because he did not meet income requirements and he lacks experience in new business, which is usually demanded by local credit providers. 

But David’s loan request was approved by Credo, as part of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides credit for business start-ups and re-startups. The program extends soft conditions to the rural poor who do not have access to credit products. They are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, David will cover the costs of purchasing his initial inventory of basic groceries for starting a grocery store. He plans to increase the turnover in his trade business gradually. Another part of the credit will be used for purchasing a milk cow. After the cow is bought, the family will produce cheese with the milk and sell it from their grocery store. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. David will work hard, and he will be able to improve the living conditions of his family. With this loan, his family will generate enough income to access regular, available credit products in the country’s capital market in the event they need it in the future.

loans.use: to start up a grocery store and buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah is 22 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are currently in school. 

For the past two years, Faridah has been working hard to manage her clothes store. 

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more clothes to sell, and it will help Faridah to generate greater profits and support her family with the basic needs. Faridah hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a wholesale business. 

Faridah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Xiomara Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Xiomara tiene 42 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, convive en unión libre con su esposo y residen en una comunidad del Municipio de Tela, Departamento de Atlántida.
Doña Xiomara desde hace 10 años inicio su negocio con el propósito de obtener otros ingresos para sacar adelante su familia junto con su esposo.

Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 15,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de maíz, frijoles, arroz, manteca, pan, condimentos, productos de aseo y limpieza, refrescos y golosinas.
Ella espera aumentar sus ventas surtiendo su negocio y brindando una buena atención a su clientela.
Ella se siente satisfecha ya que con los ingresos que obtiene apoya a sus hijos con su educación.
texts.en:
Xiomara is 42 years old, and she has three children.  She lives in a common-law marriage with her husband in a community in the Tela municipality in the Atlántida department.

Xiomara started her business ten years ago.  Her objective was to get other income, together with her husband, in order to get her family ahead. 

She has currently requested a loan for 15,000 lempiras.  She plans to use the loan to buy corn, beans, rice, shortening, bread, condiments, cleaning products, soft drinks, and candy.

She hopes to increase her sales by stocking her business and providing her customers with good service.

She is happy because she supports her children’s education with the income that she gets.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Loreta Group

texts.en:
Loreta is married and has two children and lives at Catadman, Ozamiz City. Loreta is 47 years old. 

Loreta is the leader of a two-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

Loreta is a businesswoman who sells herbal medicines like herbal oil. She had this business for almost nine years.

She joined PMPC-Ozamiz in 2009.  Loreta hopes to have a mini store soon.

loans.use: to purchase bottles and green leaves for her herbal medicines.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta, 45, is married to Jacob who operates a retail shop business. 

Jacinta has a store where she sells basic needs items, such as sugar, bread, milk, meat and bulk goods. She has two children who are in school and help with the housework. Jacinta says her parents were the ones who taught her the merchant trade and her siblings also have their own businesses.

Jacinta is requesting a loan to buy basic products for her store so she can continue offering her customers everything they need.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her store.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 44 years old and married to Rodrigo S., a jabal-jabal driver. They are blessed with five children. 

She has a general store to earn a living. She is requesting a new loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and other consumable products.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and other consumable products.

location.town: Ozamis-Sangay Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Luis Alberto tiene 51 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, está casado, reside junto a su familia en una comunidad rural del Municipio de Tela, Departamento de Atlántida.
Luis se dedica al negocio de engorde de cerdos desde hace 5 años, anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar como jornalero en fincas de palma africana.
También para generar otros ingresos se dedica a la compra y venta de palma africana.

Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 13,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de cerdos para engorde y  compra de fruta fresca de palma africana para revender.

El espera invertir sus utilidades en mejorar su vivienda para tener una mayor comodidad junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto, age 51, is married and has two children.  He lives with his family in a rural community in the Tela municipality in the Atlántida department.

Luis has been engaged in his business of fattening pigs for five years.  He previously worked as a day worker on African palm farms.  He also buys and sells African palm in order to generate other income.

He has currently requested a loan for 13,000 lempiras.  He will use the loan to buy pigs to fatten and fresh African palm fruit to sell.

He hopes to use his profits to improve his house.  He will do this so that he and his family will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten and fresh African palm fruit to sell.

loans.name: Wilton Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Wilton tiene 31 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo, convive con su esposa en unión libre, reside junto a su familia en una comunidad  del Municipio de Puerto Cortes, Departamento de Cortes.
Wilton se dedica a la venta de alimentos a través de una pulpería desde hace 3 años. 
El decidió establecer este negocio debido a la falta de empleo y a que recibió dinero de sus prestaciones laborales en la empresa donde trabajaba como obrero.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 15,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de carnes, medicamentos de uso común, maíz, frijoles, arroz, manteca, pan, condimentos, productos de aseo y limpieza, refrescos y golosinas.

El espera seguir creciendo en su negocio, mejorar como persona y brindarle educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Wilton is 31 years old and has one child.  He lives in a common-law marriage with his wife and family in a community in the Puerto Cortes municipality in the Cortes department.

Wilton has been selling food in a grocery store for three years.  He decided to establish this business due to a lack of employment.  He did this because he received money as his employment benefit from a company where he was a worker.

He has currently requested a loan for 15,000 lempiras.  He will use the loan to buy meat, common use medicine, corn, beans, rice, shortening, bread, condiments, cleaning products, soft drinks, and candy.

He hopes to continue growing in his business, improving as a person, and providing his child with an education.

loans.use: to buy products for his grocery store.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha is applying for a subsequent loan, having successfully repaid the previous loan. She is grateful, for it helped her improve her business, increasing her income, which she then used to improve her living standard. Now, she has requested a new loan, amounting to KES 50,000, to buy bundles of clothes to resell.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is engaged in a motorcycle transport business in Tala. He has been in the business for the past five years. He is 31 years old, married, and has two children, ages 6 and 3 years.

This will be his second loan term, and he plans to use the amount to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. He will also service the motorcycle and keep it in good condition for the transport business. He anticipates generating more income, which he will use to pay school fees for his children and provide for the basic needs of his family.

Jackson hopes to expand his business and to be able to buy a motor vehicle for use in transport business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and to service the motorcycle that he uses to earn a living in transport business

loans.name: Winefreda

texts.en:
Winefreda is 45 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has three children.

Winefreda owns a sari-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this work. 

She has requested a loan to purchase more stock for her general store such as soaps, shampoos and toothpaste.

Winefreda has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Winefreda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as soaps, shampoos and toothpaste for her general store.

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 20 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. 

For the past two years, Hawa has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Hawa has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more sacks of charcoal, and it will help Hawa to generate greater profits and take care of her young siblings. Hawa hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her capital from the business and start up another one. 

Hawa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to stock more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla, 34years old, is a married and hard-working person. He lives in Mwambalasi, Kenya, with his family, a wife and three children. He has a housing arrangement in which he incurs no cost for shelter. His monthly major expenditure is payment of the family's school fees.

He owns a stall, where he sells coconuts. He has approached Yehu Microfinance Trust for a loan amounting to KES 30,000 to buy coconuts at a wholesale price from farmers, for resale at his stall.

loans.use: to buy coconuts at a wholesale price from farmers.

loans.name: Wincate

texts.en:
Wincate is a 36-year-old farmer. She is married and they have two children, age 7 and 15. 

Wincate has been practicing dairy farming as her primary business and horticulture farming as her secondary business for the past four years with a monthly income of KES. 8,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan with KADET Ltd. after being introduced to KADET by an existing client. Wincate will use the loan to buy dairy feeds to improve her dairy farming business.

She will plough back the anticipated profit into the business. Her hopes and dreams are to give the best education to her children

loans.use: to buy dairy feeds to improve her dairy farming.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo menor, en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, 

Nancy continúa trabajando como contador público y el esposo es jubilado rentista de una entidad bancaria local; ellos tienen un hijo menor al cual siguen manteniendo. 
El crédito que Nancy solicita es para pagar los estudios de su hijo que aún está en la Universidad; por el carácter social, califica para un crédito en Impro y formar parte de Kiva 

El sueño de Nancy, es ver profesional a sus hijo

Es la sexta vez con IMPRO  y la segunda vez que es parte de KIVA.
texts.en:
Nancy lives in her own home with her husband and young son in the Tembladerani area of La Paz city.

Nancy continues to work as a public account and her husband is a retired landlord who was with a local bank.  They have a young son who they still maintain.

The loan that Nancy is applying for is to pay for her son's studies.  He is studying at university and, because of their circumstances, qualifies for a loan with Impro and to be part of Kiva.

Nancy's dream is to see her son become a professional.

This is her sixth loan with Impro and her second time with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay tuition at the university that her third child attends.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 43 year old married man. He has five children. He describes himself as an industrious, optimistic man, a go-getter. He operates a motorcycle, which he uses to provide transportation services. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an urban area near a university school, and his primary customers are students from the nearby university . He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy motorcycle spare parts. His business goal is to own multiple motorcycles within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will educate his children with the profits generated from the business. This is his first loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the motorcycle he uses to provide transportation services.

loans.name: Mathews

texts.en: Mathews is a 48 year old married man. He has five children. He describes himself as a humble, God-fearing and caring man. He operates a car that he uses to provide transportation services. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located near an urban area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be frequent breakdowns of the car and high costs for spare parts. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy spare parts . He hopes that, in the future, he will run a driving school. This is his second loan from SMEP DTM, after managing to repay a loan of KES 40,000.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the car he uses to provide transportation services.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is married and has five children. Dioscora is 60 years old and lives in Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. To earn a living, Dioscora has a dress shop and is a dressmaker. She has had this business for 30 years. Each month, she earns approximately 5,000.

She has requested a loan to purchase more stock of cloth for her tailoring business. Dioscora has been a member of PMPC for three years. She hopes to expand her business, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of cloth for her tailoring business

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Juan Carlos es empleado de una tienda de celulares, su nivel de educación es secundaria, vive en casa familiar ocupando 1 habitación en un acabado fino  y piso de cemento en la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Juan Carlos trabaja 8 horas al día, para cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, luz, agua, educación y otros.
El crédito lo requiere para el aumento en la compra de una movilidad que la utilizará como taxi y así mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.

El sueño de Juan Carlos es tener su negocio propio de venta de celulares.

Es la primera vez con IMPRO y la primera con Kiva.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Carlos is en employee at a cell phone store. He has a high-school level education and lives in the family house, where he has taken up one bedroom with a fine finish and cement floor in the city of La Paz. Mr. Juan Carlos works 8 hours per day to cover his expenses on food, electricity and education, among others. 

He's requesting a loan to buy a vehicle that he'll use as a taxi to increase his income and improve his quality of life. Juan Carlos' dream is to start his own business selling cell phones. 

This is his first loan with IMPRO and with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a car that he'll use as a taxi to increase his income.

loans.name: Mbabazi's Group

texts.en:
Mbabazi's Group is comprised of two hard-working women. Mbabazi is 22 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past three years, Mbabazi has been working hard to manage her small store, which sells clothes. To help expand her business, Mbabazi has requested a loan of UGX 600,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more clothes to sell, and it will help Mbabazi to generate greater profits and support her family’s basic needs. Mbabazi hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a wholesale business. 
Mbabazi is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock more clothes to sell in her store.
